member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettings
member.summary: Connection Settings interface.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsCommon
member.summary: Defines Properties that get and set connection settings common to all types of conections.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsCommon.ConnectMacro
member.summary: Gets or specifies the name of a macro that runs automatically after a connection is established.
member.remarks: You can use the ConnectMacroData property to specify information to be passed to this macro. A connect macro runs after the terminal has successfully made a connection to the host and should not include session setup information.
member.value:
The default value is "". This string can be up to 260 characters long.
This value can be changed during an open connection.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if the set parameter is longer than the maximum allowed.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsCommon.ConnectMacroData
member.summary: Gets or specifies a string that passes information to a connect macro. When the connect macro runs, the value of MacroData is set equal to the value of ConnectMacroData.
member.remarks: The value of the MacroData property changes whenever you pass macro data to a macro. (If you run a macro using the Macros dialog box, macro data is specified in the Macro data box. If you run a macro using the RunMacro method, macro data is specified with the second argument.) The ConnectMacroData property stores a fixed value that sets the value of MacroData whenever your connect macro runs.
member.value:
The default value is "". This string can be up to 260 characters long.
This value can be changed during an open connection.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if the set parameter is longer than the maximum allowed.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsCommon.DisconnectScriptArgs
member.summary: Gets or sets the text string that contains the arguments to pass to a disconnect script.
member.value:
The default value is "".
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsCommon.DisconnectScriptFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the text string that contains the name of a Reflection Basic script to run when the connection is closed.
member.value:
The default value is "".
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsCommon.ExitAllowed
member.summary: When set to true, users can quit Reflection and use the Disconnect command while connected to a host.
member.remarks: When set to false, the Exit and Disconnect commands are disabled and users must quit all active host applications and log off to terminate host connections.
member.value:
The default value is true.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsCommon.ExitOnDisconnect
member.summary: When set to true, Reflection quits automatically when you disconnect from the host.
member.value: The default value is false. This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsCommon.Parity
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of parity on the connection.
member.value: The default value is Parity8None. This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsCommon.ScriptArgs
member.summary: Gets or sets the text string that contains arguments to pass to a connect script.
member.value: The default value is "". This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsCommon.ScriptFile
member.summary: Get or set the text string that contains the name of a Reflection Basic script to run when the connection is established (for example, a logon script).
member.value: The default value is "". This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsCommon.ScriptType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of script file, either Reflection Basic (RBS) or Reflection Command Language (RCL).
member.value: The default value is Reflection Basic (RBS).

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork
member.summary: Connection settings for best network.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork.HostAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the host to which to connect.
member.value:
The default value is "".
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork.NSVTPort
member.summary: The port number to use when establishing the VT-MGR connection.
member.remarks: Port 1570 is used for streams; port 1537 is the standard port.
member.value:
You can set this to any integer value between 1 and 65535. The default is 0, which lets the NSVT protocol module choose the port.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork.TelnetBinary
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Reflection always requests a binary mode connection (an 8-bit data path).
member.remarks: A binary connection is required for some types of data transfers, such as Xmodem file transfers.
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork.TelnetBreak
member.summary: Gets or sets whether CTRL+BREAK sends the Telnet Break command or the Telnet Interrupt Process command.
member.value:
The default value is false; CTRL+BREAK sends a Telnet Interrupt Process command.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork.TelnetEcho
member.summary: Controls how Reflection responds to a remote echo from a Telnet host.
member.value:
The default value is Auto.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork.TelnetNegotateInitOptions
member.summary: Specifies whether certain connection options, including whether to always request a binary mode connection, are negotiated when the Telnet connection is established.
member.value:
The default value is false (does not negotiate Telnet options).
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork.TelnetLFAfterCR
member.summary: Specifies whether Reflection sends a linefeed character whenever a carriage return is sent.
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork.TelnetLineMode
member.summary: Reflection supports line mode and faux line mode for Telnet connections.
member.remarks:
Line mode allows Reflection to store characters in a buffer until a carriage return is entered. Then, characters are sent to the host one packet at a time (instead of sending a single character as an individual packet).
Line mode is useful for long network delays and may reduce costs on networks that charge on a per packet basis.
member.value:
The default value is Never.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork.TelnetLocation
member.summary: Reflection supports the TELNET SEND-LOCATION option (specified in RFC 779).
member.remarks: TelnetLocation sends the user's location or other information to a Telnet host.
member.value:
By default, this value is not assigned. It appears among the keywords listed by the ConnectionSettings property only you have assigned it a value.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork.TelnetPort
member.summary: Gets or sets the port to use to establish the Telnet connection.
member.value:
The default value is 23 (the standard Telnet port number).
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork.TelnetSetWindowSize
member.summary: When this value is true, Reflection sends the number of rows and columns to the Telnet host whenever they change, enabling the Telnet host to control the cursor if the window size changes.
member.value:
The default value is true.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork.TelnetTermDefault
member.summary: The terminal type string that is sent as a backup to the Telnet server if the server requests this information and doesn't recognize the current value set for TelnetTermType.
member.remarks: During negotiations, some hosts that can successfully connect using the preferred terminal type skip this value and connect using the backup value specified by TelnetTermDefault. To correct this behavior, set TelnetTermDefault to an empty string ("").
member.value:
The default value for UNIX and OpenVMS, and ReGIS Graphics is "VT100,DEC-VT100".
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork.TelnetTermType
member.summary: The terminal type string that is sent to the Telnet server if the server requests this information during the suboption TERM negotiation stage of the connection.
member.value:
The default values are "VT100" for VT emulation and "VT220" for UNIX and OpenVMS, and ReGIS Graphics.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork.TelnetTrace
member.summary: When set to true, Reflection writes the negotiation process for the various Telnet options to the screen.
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork.TelnetUseEmulatorTermType
member.summary: When this value is false, Reflection uses the current terminal setting as determined by the value of TelnetTermType when the server requests the terminal type.
member.remarks: When this value is true, Reflection uses the terminal setting as determined by the value of the DAResponse property.
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork.Timeout
member.summary: Specifies the time (in milliseconds) during which Reflection attempts to make a connection before timing out.
member.remarks:
When this setting is 0 (the default), Reflection timeout behavior is determined by your Windows operating system.
The timeout period begins after the host name is resolved.
member.value:
The default value is 0. The range of values is 0 - 65535.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet
member.summary: Defines Properties that get and set settings for telnet connections.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.Authentication
member.summary: This option enables Reflection to use Kerberos authentication.
member.remarks:
To configure Kerberos connections, use these settings: Authentication, Encryption, MutualAuthentication, Principal, Realm, RenewableTicket, TicketForwarding.
Do not set Authentication to true if you use Kerberos authentication in conjuction with Secure Shell (ConnectionType = SECURE SHELL). This and other configuration information from the Secure Shell Settings dialog box is saved in the Secure Shell configuration file.
member.value: This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.CacheName
member.summary: A string that specifies the path and filename of a credentials cache.
member.remarks: Use this setting if you have already connected a Reflection session to a kerberized host and want to start an additional session that connects to a different kerberized host.
member.value:
The default cache name is used if no other cache name is specified.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.Encryption
member.summary: Specifies whether to encrypt the data transmitted between the host and the Kerberos client during Kerberos sessions.
member.remarks: When this setting is false, the authentication (login) process is encrypted, but the subsequent data transmission is not. Encrypting the data stream decreases transmission speed.
member.value: The default value is false. This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.HostAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the host to which to connect.
member.value:
The default value is "".
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.MutualAuthentication
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable mutual authentication during Kerberos sessions.
member.remarks: When this setting is true, the service must authenticate itself to the principal.
member.value:
The default value is true.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.PKIDisableCRL
member.summary: Specifies whether Reflection checks for certificate revocation when validating host certificates for SSL/TLS connections.
member.remarks: Select this setting to disable CRL (Certificate Revocation List) checking.
member.value:
The default value of this setting is based on the current Internet Explorer setting for CRL checking. To view or change this setting, start Internet Explorer, and select Tools > Internet Options > Advanced. Under Security, view the "Check for server certificate revocation" setting.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.Principal
member.summary: Specifies the principal for which you want to obtain Kerberos credentials.
member.remarks: A full principal name includes both the principal name and the realm name, in the format [principal]@[realm name]. Use Realm to specify the realm.
member.value: This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.Realm
member.summary: Specifies the the realm portion of the full principal name.
member.remarks: A full principal name includes both the principal name and the realm name, in the format [principal]@[realm name]. Use Principal to specify the principal.
member.value: This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.RenewableTicket
member.summary: Specifies the time (in seconds) for which Kerberos Ticket Granting Tickets (TGT) are renewable.
member.value:
The default value is "604,800" (7 days).
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.TelnetBinary
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Reflection always requests a binary mode connection (an 8-bit data path).
member.remarks: A binary connection is required for some types of data transfers, such as Xmodem file transfers.
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.TelnetBreak
member.summary: Gets or sets whether CTRL+BREAK sends the Telnet Break command or the Telnet Interrupt Process command.
member.value:
The default value is false; CTRL+BREAK sends a Telnet Interrupt Process command.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.TelnetEcho
member.summary: Controls how Reflection responds to a remote echo from a Telnet host.
member.value:
The default value is Auto.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.TelnetNegotateInitOptions
member.summary: Specifies whether certain connection options, including whether to always request a binary mode connection, is negotiated when the Telnet connection is established.
member.value:
The default value is false (does not negotiate Telnet options).
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.TelnetLFAfterCR
member.summary: Specifies whether Reflection sends a linefeed character whenever a carriage return is sent.
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.TelnetLineMode
member.summary: Reflection supports line mode and faux line mode for Telnet connections.
member.remarks:
Line mode allows Reflection to store characters in a buffer until a carriage return is entered. Then, characters are sent to the host one packet at a time (instead of sending each character as an individual packet).
Line mode is useful for long network delays and may reduce costs on networks that charge on a per packet basis. The default value is Never.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.TelnetLocation
member.summary: Reflection supports the TELNET SEND-LOCATION option (specified in RFC 779).
member.remarks: TelnetLocation sends the user's location, or other information, to a Telnet host.
member.value:
By default, this value is not assigned. It appears among the keywords listed by the ConnectionSettings property only if you have assigned it a value.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.TelnetPort
member.summary: Gets or sets the port to use to establish the Telnet connection.
member.value:
The default value is 23 (the standard Telnet port number).
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.TelnetSetWindowSize
member.summary: When this value is true, Reflection sends the number of rows and columns to the Telnet host whenever they change, enabling the Telnet host to control the cursor if the window size changes.
member.value:
The default value is true.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.TelnetTermDefault
member.summary: The terminal type string that is sent as a backup to the Telnet server if the server requests this information and doesn't recognize the current value set for TelnetTermType.
member.remarks: During negotiations, some hosts that can successfully connect using your preferred terminal type skip this value and connect using the backup value specified by TelnetTermDefault. To correct this behavior, set TelnetTermDefault to an empty string ("").
member.value:
The default value UNIX and OpenVMS, and ReGIS Graphics emulations is "VT100,DEC-VT100".
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.TelnetTermType
member.summary: The terminal type string that is sent to the Telnet server if the server requests this information during the suboption TERM negotiation stage of the connection.
member.value:
The default values are "VT100" for VT emulation and "VT220" for UNIX and OpenVMS, and ReGIS Graphics emulations.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.TelnetTrace
member.summary: When set to true, Reflection writes the negotiation process for the various Telnet options to the screen.
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.TelnetUseEmulatorTermType
member.summary: When this value is false, Reflection uses the current terminal setting as determined by the value of TelnetTermType when the server requests the terminal type.
member.remarks: When this value is true, Reflection uses the terminal setting as determined by the value of the DAResponse property when the server requests the terminal type.
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.Timeout
member.summary: Specifies the time (in milliseconds) during which Reflection attempts to make a connection before timing out.
member.remarks: When this setting is 0 (the default), Reflection timeout behavior is determined by your Windows operating system. The timeout period begins after the host name is resolved.
member.value:
The default value is 0. The range of values is 0-65535.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.TLSCertifyHostname
member.summary: Specifies whether host name matching is required when validating host certificates for SSL/TLS connections.
member.remarks: When this setting is true (the default), the host name you configure in Reflection must exactly match one of the host names in the CommonName or the SubjectAltName field of the certificate.
member.value:
The default value is true.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.TLSStrength
member.summary: Specifies the minimum allowable level of encryption for SSL/TLS connections.
member.remarks: The connection fails if this level isn't provided. This setting is only relevant when UseTLS is True. When this setting is 0, Reflection negotiates with the host system to choose a level of encryption that's supported by both the host and the PC.
member.value:
The default value is 0.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.UserName
member.summary: A string that specifies the user name.
member.remarks: For Telnet connections, this setting is relevant only if Authentication is set to true.
member.value:
For Rlogin connections, the Windows user name is the default value.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.UseSOCKS
member.summary: Enables connections to a host via a SOCKS proxy server. (Available only with Reflection Network Series version 6.0.)
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsTelnet.UseTLS
member.summary: Enables Secure Socket Layer (SSL) and Transport Layer Security (TLS) security protocols for this connection.
member.remarks: The level of encryption is determined by the value you set for TLSStrength.
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.value:
The default value is "".
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

You can set this number to any integer value between 1 and 65535. The default is 0, which lets the NSVT protocol module determine the port.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsVTMgr.Timeout
member.summary: Specifies the time (in milliseconds) during which Reflection attempts to make a connection before timing out.
member.remarks: When this setting is 0 (the default), Reflection timeout behavior is determined by your Windows operating system. The timeout period begins after the host name is resolved.
member.value:

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsSecureShell
member.summary: Defines Properties that get and set connections settings for Secure Shell connections.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsSecureShell.HostAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the host to which to connect.
member.value:
The default value is "".
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsSecureShell.LowerCaseUserName
member.summary: Specifies whether Reflection converts your user name to lowercase letters.
member.value:
The default value is False.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsSecureShell.SSHAllow2048BitDSAKeys
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether SSH connections should allow 2048-bit keys in FIPS mode. When this value is true, a Secure Shell connection will allow a non-FIPS 2048 bit host key verification outside the FIPS boundry.
member.value: The default value is False. This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsSecureShell.SSHConfigScheme
member.summary: Specifies the SSH config scheme settings to use for making a Secure Shell connection.
member.remarks: Reflection uses the SSH config scheme settings when you make a Secure Shell connection. If a SSH config scheme is not specified, Reflection uses a SSH config scheme that matches the current host name (if one exists) or the default Secure Shell settings (if a matching SSH config scheme doesn't exist).
member.value: This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsSecureShell.SSHPort
member.summary: The protocol port to use to establish the Secure Shell connection.
member.value: This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsSecureShell.SSHShowBannerDialog
member.summary: Specifies whether Reflection displays banner information in a dialog box before completing the Secure Shell connection.
member.remarks: This setting is relevant only if your host is configured to display banners. Banner display can be surpressed by setting the Secure Shell Logging Level to Quiet.
member.value:
The default value is true.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsSecureShell.SSHSetHostWindowSize
member.summary: When this value is true, Reflection sends the number of rows and columns to the host whenever they change, enabling the host to control the cursor if the window size changes.
member.value:
The default value is true.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsSecureShell.SSHTermDefault
member.summary: The terminal type string that is sent as a backup to the Telnet server if the server requests this information and doesn't recognize the current value set for SSHTermType.
member.remarks: During negotiations, some hosts that can successfully connect using your preferred terminal type skip this value and connect using the backup value specified by SSHTermDefault. To correct this behavior, set SSHTermDefault to an empty string ("").
member.value: The default value for UNIX and OpenVMS, and ReGIS Graphics emulations is "VT100,DEC-VT100".

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsSecureShell.SSHTermType
member.summary: The terminal type string that is sent to the server if the server requests this information during the suboption TERM negotiation stage of the connection.
member.remarks: The default values are "VT100" for VT emulation, and "VT220" for UNIX and OpenVMS, and ReGIS Graphics emuations.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsSecureShell.SSHTermWindowAuth
member.summary: When this value is true, a Secure Shell connection will use the terminal window for the user authentication, displaying the server banner and checking the host key (Normally, all these are done in separate dialogs). This log-in behavior is similar to telnet and allows for scripting.
member.value:
The default value is False.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsSecureShell.Timeout
member.summary: Specifies the time (in milliseconds) during which Reflection attempts to make a connection before timing out.
member.remarks:
When this setting is 0 (the default), Reflection timeout behavior is determined by your Windows operating system.
The timeout period begins after the host name is resolved.
member.value:
The default value is 0. The range of values is 0-65535.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsSecureShell.UsePCUserName
member.summary: Specifies whether Reflection uses the current Windows user name for Rlogin connections.
member.remarks: When set to false, Reflection uses the name specified in the User name box in the Connection Settings dialog box (or with the UserName Connection keyword). When set to true, Reflection connects using the Windows user name and disables User name in the Connection Settings dialog box. The default is false.
member.value: This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsSecureShell.UserName
member.summary: A string that specifies the user name.
member.remarks: For Telnet connections, this setting is relevant only if Authentication is set to true.
member.value:
For Rlogin connections, the Windows user name is the default value.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsRLogin
member.summary: Defines Properties that get and set Rlogin connection settings including: user names, port, terminal types, and timeout values.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsRLogin.LowerCaseUserName
member.summary: Specifies whether Reflection converts your user name to lowercase letters.
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsRLogin.RloginPort
member.summary: The protocol port used to establish the Rlogin connection.
member.value:
The default value is 513.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsRLogin.RloginTermType
member.summary: The terminal type used during Rlogin connection negotiations to set terminal characteristics for the session.
member.value: This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsRLogin.Timeout
member.summary: Specifies the time (in milliseconds) during which Reflection attempts to make a connection before timing out.
member.remarks:
When this setting is 0 (the default), Reflection timeout behavior is determined by your Windows operating system.
The timeout period begins after the host name is resolved.
member.value:
The default value is 0. The range of values is 0 - 65535.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsRLogin.UsePCUserName
member.summary: Specifies whether Reflection uses the current Windows user name for Rlogin connections.
member.remarks: When set to false, Reflection uses the name specified in the User name box in the Connection Settings dialog box (or with the UserName Connection keyword). When set to true, Reflection connects using the Windows user name and disables the User name specified in the Connection Settings dialog box.
member.value:
The default is false.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsRLogin.UserName
member.summary: A string that specifies the user name.
member.remarks: For Telnet connections, this setting is relevant only if Authentication is set to true.

For Rlogin connections, the Windows user name is the default value.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem
member.summary: Defines Properties that get and set connection settings for Modem connections.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.Baud
member.summary: Baud rate setting.
member.remarks: The available settings are Baud300, Baud600, Baud1200, Baud1800, Baud2400, Baud3600, Baud4800, Baud7200, Baud9600, Baud14400, Baud19200, Baud38400, Baud57600, Baud115200, and DEFAULT. These values are defined in Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.BaudRateOption.
member.value:
The default setting for connecton type MODEM is Default.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.CharDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the time delay (in milliseconds) between characters.
member.value: This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.CheckParity
member.summary: Gets or sets the parity check state.
member.remarks: When set to true and Parity is other than 8/None, Reflection checks parity on all received characters.
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.CTSrequired
member.summary: When set to true, Reflection does not transmit unless the RS-232 Clear To Send (CTS) signal is active.
member.remarks: Set this keyword to false if ReceivedPacing is set to Hardware.
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.DropDTROnDisconnect
member.summary: When set to true, the Data Terminal Ready (DTR) signal is dropped when the connection is closed.
member.remarks: Set this value to false, to keep the DTR signal after closing the connection or quitting Reflection.
member.value:
The default value is true.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.DSRrequired
member.summary: When set to true, Reflection does not transmit data unless the RS-232 Data Set Ready (DSR) signal is active.
member.remarks: Set this value to false if ReceivePacing is set to Hardware.
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.LineDelay
member.summary: Time delay (in tenths of a second) between lines.
member.value:
The default value is 0. The range of values is 0 - 255 (tenths of a second).
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.ModemAreaCode
member.summary: A string that specifies the area code (or city code) of the number being dialed.
member.value:
The default value is the current area code as configured using the Windows Control Panel. The string can be up to 64 characters long.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.ModemCountryName
member.summary: A string that specifies the country of the number being dialed.
member.remarks: To see possible values, refer to the Country Code list in the Connection Settings dialog box. If the country code name you choose for this value contains spaces, enclose the string in quotation marks.
member.value:
The default value is the current country as configured using the Windows Control Panel. This string can be up to 64 characters long.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.ModemInitString
member.summary: The modem command string that initializes the modem.
member.value:
The default value (DEFAULT) uses the string for the selected modem name.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.ModemLocation
member.summary: A string that indentifies the current modem location. Modem locations are configured using Control Panel modems.
member.remarks: If the modem location name you choose includes spaces, enclose the string in quotation marks.
member.value:
The default value is the current modem location as configured using the Windows Control Panel. This string can be up to 64 characters long.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.ModemMode
member.summary: Identifies the operating mode for the modem.
member.remarks: The available modes are Call, AutoAnswer, Answer, Direct and DialBack. Their values are defined in Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ModemModeOption.
member.value:
The default value is ModemModeOption.Call.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

members.member:
The text string that identifies the type of modem being used.
A default value is configured automatically based on your current modem configuration.
This string can be up to 64 characters long.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open. >

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.ModemPhoneNumber
member.summary: The phone number to dial.
member.remarks: If you use the Control Panel modems with ModemUseDialingRules set to true (the default configuration), Reflection automatically adds the appropriate prefix to the specified phone number, based on the current values of ModemAreaCode, ModemCountryName and ModemLocation.
member.value: The default value is "". This string can be up to 64 characters long. This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.ModemShowDisconnectErrors
member.summary: Determines whether the "Remote Party Disconnected" error message appears when the modem connection is dropped.
member.remarks: Set this value to false to ensure that fully scripted modem connections can run without user interaction.
member.value:
The default value is true.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.ModemUseDialingRules
member.summary: When set to true, the TAPI modem dialer adds the appropriate prefix to the number you are dialing, based on the current values of ModemAreaCode, ModemCountryName, and ModemLocation.
member.remarks:
When set to false, the modem dialer dials the phone number exactly as specified by ModemPhoneNumber.
Changing this value is the equivalent to changing the "Use Country code and City code" setting in the Connection Settings dialog box.
member.value:
The default value is true.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.ReceivePacing
member.summary: Type of flow control to use for receiving data from the host.
member.value:
The available settings are XonXoff, None, Hardware. These settings are defined in Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ReceivePacingOption.
The default value is XonXoff.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.StopBits
member.summary: The number of stop bits that follow each character during data transmission.
member.value:
The available settings are One and Two. These settings are defined in Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.StopBitsOption.
The default value is One.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.TransmitPacing
member.summary: Type of flow control to use for transmitting data to the host.
member.remarks: The available settings are XonXoff, None, Hardware. These settings are defined in Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.TransmitPacingOption.
member.value: The default setting for VT, Unix and OpenVMS, and ReGIS Graphics emulation is XonXoff. This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.XoffRepeat
member.summary: The number of characters that Reflection accepts after receiving an XOFF and before sending another XOFF.
member.value:
The default value is 32. The range is 0 - 9999.
This value can be changed during an open connection.
member.exception: Thrown if the set parameter is outside the range of valid values.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsModem.XoffTimeout
member.summary: The length of time (in seconds) to wait after sending data before Reflection sends an XOFF character.
member.value:
The default value is 10 seconds. The range is 0 - 9999.
This value can be changed during an open connection.
member.exception: Thrown if the set parameter is outside the range of valid values.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort
member.summary: ConnectionSettingsComSerialPort interface.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort.Baud
member.summary: Sets the baud rate.
member.remarks: The available settings are Baud300, Baud600, Baud1200, Baud1800, Baud2400, Baud3600, Baud4800, Baud7200, Baud9600, Baud14400, Baud19200, Baud38400, Baud57600, Baud115200, DEFAULT. These values are defined in Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.BaudRateOption.
member.value:
The default setting for connection types COM1 through COM8 is Baud9600.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort.CharDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the time delay (in milliseconds) between characters.
member.value: This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort.CheckParity
member.summary: Gets or sets the parity check state on all received characters, when set to true (the default) and Parity is other than 8/None.
member.value: This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort.CTSrequired
member.summary: When set to true, Reflection transmits only if the RS-232 Clear To Send (CTS) signal is active.
member.remarks: Set the value to false (the default) if ReceivedPacing is set to Hardware.
member.value: This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort.DropDTROnDisconnect
member.summary: When set to true (the default), the Data Terminal Ready (DTR) signal is dropped when the connection closes.
member.remarks: Set this value to false to keep the DTR signal high even after closing the connection or quitting Reflection.
member.value: This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort.DSRrequired
member.summary: When set to true, Reflection transmits data only if the RS-232 Data Set Ready (DSR) signal is active.
member.remarks: Set this value to false (the default) if ReceivePacing is set to Hardware.
member.value: This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort.EnhancedSerialDataCom
member.summary: Specifies the Reflection enhanced communications driver (when set to true).
member.remarks: Set this value to false (the default) if you have a third-party driver that must use the standard Windows data communications driver (Comm.drv).
member.value: This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort.LineDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the time delay (in tenths of a second) between lines.
member.value: The default value is 0. The range of values is 0 - 255 (tenths of a second). This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort.ReceivePacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of flow control to use for receiving data from the host.
member.value: The available settings are None, Hardware, and XonXoff (the default). These settings are defined in Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ReceivePacingOption. This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort.StopBits
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of stop bits that follow each character during data transmission.
member.value:
The available settings are One and Two. These settings are defined in Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.StopBitsOption.
The default value is One.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort.SerialPort
member.summary: Gets or sets the COM serial port number.
member.remarks: Setting this property resets all connection settings for this connection type to their default values.
member.value: This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort.TransmitPacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of flow control to use for transmitting data to the host.
member.value:
The available settings are: XonXoff, None, and Hardware. These settings are defined in Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.TransmitPacingOption.
XonXoff is the default setting for VT, UNIX and OpenVMS, and ReGIS Graphics emulation. This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort.XoffRepeat
member.summary: Specifies the number of characters that Reflection accepts after receiving an XOFF and before sending another XOFF.
member.value:
The default value is 32. The range is 0 - 9999.
This value can be changed during an open connection.
member.exception: Thrown if the set parameter is outside the range of valid values.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort.XoffTimeout
member.summary: Specifies the length of time (in seconds) to wait after sending data and before Reflection sends an XOFF character.
member.value:
The default value is 10 seconds. The range is 0 - 9999.
This value can be changed during an open connection.
member.exception: Thrown if the set parameter is outside the range of valid values.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Authentication
member.summary: Enables Reflection to use Kerberos authentication.
member.remarks: Use these settings to configure Kerberos connections: Authentication, Encryption, MutualAuthentication, Principal, Realm, RenewableTicket, TicketForwarding. Do not set Authentication to true if you use Kerberos authentication in conjuction with Secure Shell (ConnectionType = SECURE SHELL). This configuration information, like all information configured in the Secure Shell Settings Dialog Box, is saved in the Secure Shell Configuration file.
member.value: This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.summary: Baud rate setting.

member.value:
The default setting for connection types COM1 through COM8 is Baud9600.
Value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.CacheName
member.summary:
A string specifying the path and file name of a credentials cache.
Use this setting if you have already connected a Reflection session to a kerberized host, and you want to be able to create an additional session that connects to a different kerberized host.
member.value:
The default cache name is used if no other cache name is specified.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.ConnectMacro
member.summary: Gets or specifies the name of a macro that runs automatically after a connection is established. You can use the ConnectMacroData property to specify information to be passed to this macro.
member.remarks: The connect macro runs after the terminal has successfully made a connection to the host. They should not include session setup information.
member.value:
The default value is "". This string can be up to 260 characters long.
Value can be changed during an open connection.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if the set parameter is longer than the maximum allowed.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.ConnectMacroData
member.summary: Gets or specifies a string that passes information to a connect macro. When your connect macro runs, the value of MacroData is set equal to the value of ConnectMacroData.
member.remarks: The value of the MacroData property changes whenever you pass macro data to a macro. (If you run a macro using the Macros dialog box, macro data is specified in the Macro data box. If you run a macro using the RunMacro method, macro data is specified with the second argument.) The ConnectMacroData property stores a fixed value that sets the value of MacroData whenever your connect macro runs.
member.value:
The default value is "". This string can be up to 260 characters long.
Value can be changed during an open connection.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if the set parameter is longer than the maximum allowed.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Encryption
member.summary: Specifies whether to encrypt the data transmitted between the host and the Kerberos client during Kerberos sessions.
member.remarks: When this setting is false, the authentication (login) process is encrypted, but not subsequent data transmission. Encrypting the data stream will decrease transmission speed.
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.EnhancedSerialDataCom
member.summary: Set this to true to use the Reflection enhanced communications driver.
member.remarks: Set to false if you have a third-party driver that must use the standard Windows data communications driver (Comm.drv).
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.ExitAllowed
member.summary: When set to true, users can exit Reflection and use the Disconnect command while connected to a host.
member.remarks: When set to false, the Exit and Disconnect commands are disabled and users must quit all active host applications and log off to terminate host connections.
member.value:
The default value is true.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.ExitOnDisconnect
member.summary: When set to true, Reflection closes automatically when you disconnect from the host.
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.summary: Specifies whether Reflection converts your user name to all lowercase letters.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.ModemAreaCode
member.summary: A string specifying the area code (or city code) of the number being dialed.
member.value:
The default value is the current area code as configured using the Windows Control Panel. The string can be up to 64 characters long.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.ModemCountryName
member.summary: A string specifying the country of the number being dialed.
member.remarks: To see possible values, refer to the Country Code list in the Connection Setup dialog box. Country code names contain spaces, so you should use quotation marks if you are using a literal string for the value.
member.value:
The default value is the current country as configured using the Windows Control Panel. This string can be up to 64 characters long.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.ModemInitString
member.summary: Modem command string that initializes the modem.
member.value:
The defult value is DEFAULT, meaning that the string for the selected modem name is used as the default.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.ModemLocation
member.summary: A string indentifying the current modem location.
member.remarks: Modem locations are configured using Control Panel modems. If your modem location name includes spaces, you should put the string within quotation marks.
member.value:
The default value is the current modem location as configured using the Windows Control Panel. This string can be up to 64 characters long.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.ModemMode
member.summary: Identifies the modem's operating mode (Call, AutoAnswer, Answer, Direct or DialBack).
member.value:
Their values are defined in Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ModemModeOption.
The default value is ModemModeOption.Call.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.ModemName
member.summary: Text string that identifies the type of modem being used.
member.value:
A default value is configured automatically based on your current modem configuration. This string can be up to 64 characters long.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.ModemPhoneNumber
member.summary: The phone number to dial.
member.remarks: If you use the Control Panel modems with ModemUseDialingRules set to true (the default configuration), Reflection automatically adds appropriate prefixes to the specified phone number, based on the current values of ModemAreaCode, ModemCountryName and ModemLocation.
member.value: The default value is "". This string can be up to 64 characters long. This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.ModemShowDisconnectErrors
member.summary: Determines whether the "Remote Party Disconnected" error message appears when the modem connection is dropped.
member.remarks: Set this value to false if you are creating fully scripted modem connections and you want to ensure that they can run without user interaction.
member.value:
The default value is true.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.ModemUseDialingRules
member.summary: When set to true, the TAPI modem dialer adds the appropriate dialing prefixes to the number you are dialing, based on the current values of ModemAreaCode, ModemCountryName, and ModemLocation.
member.remarks: When set to false, the modem dialer will dial the phone number exactly as specified by ModemPhoneNumber. Changing this value is equivalent to changing the "Use Country code and Area code" setting in the Connection Settings dialog box.
member.value:
The default value is true.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.MutualAuthentication
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable mutual authentication during Kerberos sessions.
member.remarks: When this setting is true, the service must authenticate itself to the principal.
member.value:
The default value is true.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork#NSVTPort
member.summary: The port number to use when establishing the VT-MGR connection.
member.remarks: Port 1570 is used for streams; port 1537 is the standard port.
member.value:
You can set this to any integer value between 1 and 65535. The default is 0, which lets the NSVT protocol module choose the port.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectionSettingsVTMgr#NSVTPort
member.summary: The port number to use when establishing the VT-MGR connection.
member.remarks: Port 1570 is used for streams; port 1537 is the standard port.
member.value:
You can set this to any integer value between 1 and 65535. The default is 0, which lets the NSVT protocol module choose the port.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Parity
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of parity on the connection.
member.value:
The default value is Parity8None.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.PKIDisableCRL
member.summary: Specifies whether Reflection checks for certificate revocation when validating host certificates during a SSL/TLS connection.
member.remarks: Select this setting to disable CRL (Certificate Revocation List) checking.
member.value:
The default value of this setting is based on your current system setting for CRL checking. To view and edit the system setting, start Internet Explorer, and go to Tools > Internet Options > Advanced. Under Security, determine if "Check for server certificate revocation" is selected.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Principal
member.summary: Specifies the principal for which you want to obtain Kerberos credentials.
member.remarks: A full principal name includes both the principal name and the realm name, in the format [principal]@[realm name]. Use Realm to specify the realm.
member.value: This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Realm
member.summary: Specifies the realm portion of the full principal name.
member.remarks: A full principal name includes both the principal name and the realm name, in the format [principal]@[realm name]. Use Principal to specify the principal.
member.value: This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort#ReceivePacing
member.summary: Specifies the type of flow control to use for receiving data from the host.
member.value:
The available settings are XonXoff, None, Hardware. Their values are defined in Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ReceivePacingOption
The default value is XonXoff.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectionSettingsModem#ReceivePacing
member.summary: Specifies the type of flow control to use for receiving data from the host.
member.value:
The available settings are XonXoff, None, Hardware. Their values are defined in Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ReceivePacingOption
The default value is XonXoff.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.RenewableTicket
member.summary: Specifies the time period (in seconds) during which Kerberos Ticket Granting Tickets (TGT) are renewable.
member.value:
The default value is "604,800" (7 days).
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.RloginPort
member.summary: The protocol port to use to establish the Rlogin connection.
member.value:
The default value is 513.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.RloginTermType
member.summary: The terminal type used during Rlogin connection negotiations to set terminal characteristics for the session.
member.value: This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.ScriptArgs
member.summary: Gets or sets the text string containing the arguments to pass to a connect script.
member.value:
The default value is "".

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.ScriptFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the text string containing the name of a Reflection Basic script to run when the connection is established; for example, a logon script.
member.value:
The default value is "".
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.ScriptType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of script file, either Reflection Basic or Reflection command language.
member.value: The default value is ReflectionBasic.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.SerialPort
member.summary: Gets or sets the COM serial port number.
member.remarks: When you set this property, all connection settings for this connection type are reset to their default values.
member.value: This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.SSHConfigScheme
member.summary: Specifies the SSH config scheme settings to use for making a Secure Shell connection.
member.remarks: Reflection uses the settings for that scheme when you make a Secure Shell connection. When no SSH config scheme is specified, Reflection looks for an SSH config scheme that matches the current host name. If a matching scheme is found, Reflection uses the settings for that host. If no matching scheme is found, Reflection uses the default Secure Shell settings.
member.value: This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.SSHPort
member.summary: The protocol port to use to establish the Secure Shell connection.
member.value: This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.SSHShowBannerDialog
member.summary: Specifies whether Reflection displays banner information in a dialog box before completing the Secure Shell connection.
member.remarks:
This setting is only relevant if your host is configured to display banners.
Banner display can also be suppressed by setting the Secure Shell Logging Level to Quiet.
member.value:
The default value is true.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.SSHSetHostWindowSize
member.summary: When this value is true, Reflection sends the number of rows and columns to the host whenever they change, enabling the host to control the cursor if the window size changes.
member.value:
The default value is true.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.SSHTermDefault
member.summary: The terminal type string that should be sent as a backup to the Telnet server if the server requests this information and doesn't recognize the current value set for SSHTermType.
member.remarks: During negotiations, some hosts that can successfully connect using your preferred terminal type skip over this value and connect using the backup value specified by SSHTermDefault. To correct this behavior, set SSHTermDefault to an empty string ("").
member.value: The Reflection default value for UNIX and OpenVMS, and ReGIS Graphics emulations is "VT100,DEC-VT100".

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.SSHTermType
member.summary: The terminal type string that should be sent to the server if the server requests this information during the suboption TERM negotiation stage of the connection.
member.value: The Reflection default values are "VT100" for VT emulation, and "VT220" for UNIX and OpenVMS, and ReGIS Graphics emulations.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.SSHAllow2048BitDSAKeys
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether SSH connections should allow 2048-bit keys in FIPS mode. When this value is true, a Secure Shell connection will allow a non-FIPS 2048 bit host key verification outside the FIPS boundry.
member.value: The default value is False. This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.SSHTermWindowAuth
member.summary: When this value is true, a Secure Shell connection will use the terminal window for the user authentication, displaying the server banner and checking the host key (Normally, all these are done in separate dialogs). This log-in behavior is similar to telnet and allows for scripting.
member.value:
The default value is False.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort#StopBits
member.summary: The number of stop bits that follow each character during data transmission.
member.value:
The available values are One and Two. Their values are defined in Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.StopBitsOption.
The default value is One.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectionSettingsModem#StopBits

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork#TelnetLFAfterCR
member.summary: Specifies whether Reflection sends a linefeed character whenever a carriage return is sent.

The default value is False.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectionSettingsTelnet#TelnetLFAfterCR
member.summary: Specifies whether Reflection sends a linefeed character whenever a carriage return is sent.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork#TelnetLineMode
member.summary: Specifies whether Reflection uses line mode for Telnet connections.
member.remarks:
Line mode allows Reflection to store characters in a buffer until a carriage return is entered, upon which the characters are sent to the host one packet at a time (instead of sending each single character as an individual packet).
Line mode is useful for long network delays, and allows you to reduce costs on networks that charge on a per packet basis.
member.value:
The default value is Never.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectionSettingsTelnet#TelnetLineMode
member.summary: Specifies whether Reflection uses line mode for Telnet connections.
member.remarks:
Line mode allows Reflection to store characters in a buffer until a carriage return is entered, upon which the characters are sent to the host one packet at a time (instead of sending each single character as an individual packet).
Line mode is useful for long network delays, and allows you to reduce costs on networks that charge on a per packet basis.
member.value:
The default value is Never.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork#TelnetLocation
member.summary: Reflection supports the TELNET SEND-LOCATION option (specified in RFC 779).
member.remarks: TelnetLocation sends the user's location, or other information, to a Telnet host.
member.value:
By default, this value is not assigned. It only appears among the keywords listed by the ConnectionSettings property if you assigned it a value.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.summary: When this value is false, Reflection uses the current terminal setting as determined by the value of TelnetTermType when the server requests the terminal type.
member.remarks: When this value is true, Reflection uses terminal setting as determined by the value of the DAResponse property.
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectionSettingsTelnet#TelnetUseEmulatorTermType
member.summary: When this value is false, Reflection uses the current terminal setting as determined by the value of TelnetTermType when the server requests the terminal type.
member.remarks: When this value is true, Reflection uses the terminal setting as determined by the value of the DAResponse property.
member.value:
The default value is false.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectingSettingsBestNetwork#Timeout
member.summary: Specifies the time period (in milliseconds) during which Reflection attempts to make a connection before timing out.
member.remarks:
When this setting is 0 (the default), Reflection timeout behavior is determined by your Windows operating system.
The timeout period begins after the host name is resolved. This means an additional delay equal to the amount of time required for host resolution, usually a few seconds beyond the value specified.
member.value:
The default value is 0. The range of values is 0 - 65535.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectionSettingsRLogin#Timeout
member.summary: Specifies the time period (in milliseconds) during which Reflection attempts to make a connection before timing out.
member.remarks: When this setting is 0 (the default), Reflection timeout behavior is determined by your Windows operating system. The timeout period begins after the host name is resolved. This means an additional delay equal to the amount of time required for host resolution, usually a few seconds beyond the value specified.
member.value:
The default value is 0. The range of values is 0 - 65535.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectionSettingsSecureShell#Timeout
member.summary: Specifies the time period (in milliseconds) during which Reflection attempts to make a connection before timing out.
member.remarks:
When this setting is 0 (the default), Reflection timeout behavior is determined by your Windows operating system.
The timeout period begins after the host name is resolved. This means an additional delay equal to the amount of time required for host resolution, usually a few seconds beyond the value specified.
member.value:
The default value is 0. The range of values is 0 - 65535.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.TLSCertifyHostname
member.summary: Specifies whether host name matching is required when validating host certificates during SSL/TLS connections.
member.remarks: When this setting is true (the default), the host name you configure in Reflection must exactly match one of the host names entered in either the CommonName or the SubjectAltName field of the certificate.
member.value:
The default value is true.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.TLSStrength
member.summary: Specifies the minimum allowable level of encryption for SSL/TLS connections.
member.remarks: The connection will fail if this level cannot be provided. This setting is only relevant when UseTLS is true. When this setting is 0, Reflection negotiates with the host system to choose a level supported by both the host and the PC.
member.value:
The default value is 0.
This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectionSettingsComSerialPort#TransmitPacing
member.summary: Specifies the type of flow control to use for transmitting data to the host.
member.remarks:
The available settings are XonXoff, None, Hardware. Their values are defined in Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.TransmitPacingOption.
The default setting for VT, Unix and OpenVMS, and ReGIS Graphics emulations is XonXoff.
member.value: This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectionSettingsModem#TransmitPacing
member.summary: Specifies the type of flow control to use for transmitting data to the host.
member.remarks:
The available settings are XonXoff, None, Hardware. Their values are defined in Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.TransmitPacingOption.
The default setting for VT, Unix and OpenVMS, and ReGIS Graphics emulations is XonXoff.
member.value: This value can be changed during an open connection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectionSettingsRLogin#UsePCUserName
member.summary: Specifies whether Reflection uses the current Windows user name as the user name for Rlogin connections.
member.remarks: When set to false, Reflection uses the name specified in the User name box in the Connection Setup dialog box (or with the UserName Connection keyword). When set to true, Reflection connects using the Windows user name and d isables User name in the Connection Setup dialog box.
member.value:
The default is false.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectionSettingsSecureShell#UsePCUserName
member.summary: Specifies whether Reflection uses the current Windows user name as the user name for Rlogin connections.
member.remarks: When set to false, Reflection uses the name specified in the User name box in the Connection Setup dialog box (or with the UserName Connection keyword). When set to true, Reflection connects using the Windows user name and disables User name in the Connection Setup dialog box.
member.value:
The default is false.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.Attachmate#Reflection#Emulation#OpenSystems#IConnectionSettingsRLogin#UserName
member.summary: A string specifying the user name.
member.remarks: For Telnet connections, this setting is relevant only if Authentication is set to true.
member.value:
For Rlogin connections, the Windows user name is the default value.
This value cannot be changed if the connection is open.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionSettings.UseTLS
member.summary: Enables Secure Socket Layer (SSL) and Transport Layer Security (TLS) security protocols for this connection.
member.remarks: The level of encryption is determined by the value you set for TLSStrength.

member.summary: The number of characters that Reflection will accept after an XOFF is received before sending another XOFF.
member.value:
The default value is 32. The range is 0 - 9999.
This value can be changed during an open connection.
