member.summary: When this property is set to True, Reflection performs the character set translations specified on the Translation tab in the File Transfer Setup dialog box, as well as the translations between the host character set and the PC character set, as specified on the Emulation tab in the Terminal Setup dialog box. This property affects ASCII transfers.
member.value: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.FileTransfer.ZmodemFileNamesTranslationEnabled
member.summary:
Returns or specifies whether the File name translation options on the Translation tab in the File Transfer Setup dialog box are used for Zmodem transfers. These options correspond to the following properties:
Transfer8Dot3FilenameCase TransferReceiveAs8Dot3 TransferSpacesToUnderscores TransferUnderscoresToSpaces
member.value: The default value is false.

member.name: E:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.FileTransfer.FileTransferDone
member.summary: The event occurs when a file transfer completes.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.FTPClearConnectionOption
member.summary: Specifies how logon information on the FTP tab of the File Transfer Setup dialog box is cleared (and not used to log in to new hosts).

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.FTPClearConnectionOption.ClearNever
member.summary: Never clears logon information from the FTP tab.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.FTPClearConnectionOption.ClearOnDisconnect
member.summary: Clears the logon information when you disconnect from the current host connection.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.FTPClearConnectionOption.ClearOnHostNameChange
member.summary: Clears the logon information when you change the host name.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.FTPClearConnectionOption.ClearAlways
member.summary: Clears the logon information on disconnect or host name change.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.FTPServerOption
member.summary: Options for specifying additional, non-default behavior for the FTPStartServer method

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.FTPServerOption.None
member.summary: Specifies no options.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.FTPServerOption.Anonymous
member.summary: Specifies that Reflection use anonymous FTP when performing transfers.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.FTPServerOption.NoLogInDialog
member.summary: Specifies that no FTP Log In dialog appears if the FTP user name or password is not provided.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.GraphicDestinationOption
member.summary: Destination of graphic images.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.GraphicDestinationOption.ToPrinter
member.summary: Images are sent to a digital printer.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.GraphicDestinationOption.ToHost
member.summary: Images are sent to the host.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.GraphicsLevelOption
member.summary: Graphics level option.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.GraphicsLevelOption.Level1
member.summary: Level 1 sixel devices have an aspect ratio of 2:1 (two horizontal pixels to one vertical pixel), and a horizontal grid size of about 188 by 0.025 mm (7.5 by 0.001 inches).
member.remarks:
Level 1 devices, which include Digital's LA50 printer, do not support the following sixel commands:
Set raster attributes
Background select
Horizontal grid size
Macro parameter

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.GraphicsLevelOption.Level2
member.summary: Level 2 sixel devices, which include Digital's LA75 and LN03 printers, have a variable aspect ratio and variable horizontal grid size; the default aspect ratio is 1:1.
member.remarks: These devices also support the sixel commands that level 1 devices don't. If you want to print expanded or rotated images on an LA75 printer, use rcLevel1 instead; this compensates for differences between Reflection and the printer. In general, level 2 printers can also operate at level 1. Digital's LA210 printer is similar to a level 2 device, but does not recognize the set raster attributes command.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.GraphicsLevelOption.LA210
member.summary: The LA210 uses a 1:1 aspect ratio with a horizontal grid size of about 338 by 0.025 mm (13 by 0.001 inches).
member.remarks: Some printers understand only a certain level of graphics. The LA50, for example, is a Level 1 printer and cannot operate at Level 2. By contrast, if you use an LA210 printer, you can select either LA210 or Level 1.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.GraphicsPrintModeOption
member.summary: Graphic print mode options.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.GraphicsPrintModeOption.Compress
member.summary: Prints the page vertically (that is, with the longest edge of the paper on the sides).

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.GraphicsPrintModeOption.Rotate
member.summary: Prints the page horizontally (that is, with the longest edge of the paper on the top and bottom).

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.GraphicsPrintModeOption.Expand
member.summary: Prints the page vertically, but with characters twice as high and twice as wide as for rcCompress.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.GraphicsTerminalTypeOption
member.summary: Defines which terminal is emulated, and how many shades or colors are available.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.GraphicsTerminalTypeOption.VT240
member.summary: Emulates a VT240 terminal, with 4 monochrome shades.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.GraphicsTerminalTypeOption.VT241
member.summary: Emulates a VT241 terminal, with 4-color capability.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.GraphicsTerminalTypeOption.VT330
member.summary: Emulates a VT330 terminal, with 4 monochrome shades.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.GraphicsTerminalTypeOption.VT340
member.summary: Emulates a VT340 terminal, with 16-color capability.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.HostCharacterSetOption
member.summary: Host character set.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.HostStatusLineOption
member.summary: Host status line dislay options.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.HostStatusLineOption.NoStatusLine
member.summary: Does not display the VT status line.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.HostStatusLineOption.Indicator
member.summary: When HostStatusLine is set to rcIndicator, it shows the current row and column of the text cursor and the printer status.
member.remarks:
The position of the text cursor is always relative to the display and starts from row 1, column 1 at the top left.
The printer status appears as "Printer: [mode]." The [mode] depends on whether logging is enabled in the Logging Settings dialog box. (To open this dialog box, click the Logging group on the Tools ribbon.)

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.HostStatusLineOption.HostWritable
member.summary: The control function DECSASD determines whether the terminal window or the status line is the active area for displaying messages from host applications.

member.summary: Options for specifying the type of host with which Reflection expects to interact.
member.remarks: This is relevant only for transfers that use the WRQ/Reflection protocol.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IHotSpots.Save
member.summary: Saves changes to current hotspots map. If the current hotspots map (identified by the HotspotsMap property) resides in the installation directory and cannot be written to, the map is saved to the current user's Hotspots Maps subfolder underneath the Reflection folder, using the terminal session name as the hotspot map filename.
member.returns: One of the ReturnCode enumerated values, unless an exception has been thrown
member.exception: An I/O error occurred while trying to save the hotspots map.
The caller does not have the required permission to save the hotspots map.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IHotSpots.DefaultHotspotMapName
member.summary: Gets the path and filename that the Save method saves a hotspot to when the location defined by the HotspotsMap property is read-only.
member.remarks: The Save method saves the in-memory hotspot collection to the hotspot file defined by the HotspotsMap property. However, if that location points at a read-only location such as the built-ins folder underneath program files\attachmate\reflection where files cannot be written to, then the Save method saves the file in the user's documents area (e.g. Documents\Attachmate\Reflection\Hotspots Maps) under the name of the active session.

member.summary: Gets a set of all the hotspots that have been mapped in the current hotspot map.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.HotSpots.DefaultHotspotMapName
member.summary: Gets the path and filename that the Save method saves a hotspot to when the location defined by the HotspotsMap property is read-only.
member.remarks: The Save method saves the in-memory hotspot collection to the hotspot file defined by the HotspotsMap property. However, if that location points at a read-only location such as the built-ins folder underneath program files\attachmate\reflection where files cannot be written to, then the Save method saves the file in the user's documents area (e.g. Documents\Attachmate\Reflection\Hotspots Maps) under the name of the active session.

member.summary: Operates as a Return key.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IbmEnterKeyOption.Send
member.summary: Operates as a Send key.

member.summary: Indicates what the Insert key does in a IBM 3151 terminal session (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.summary: Inserts a space.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IbmInsertionOption.ModeToggle
member.summary: Switches insert mode on and off.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IbmPrintCharactersOption
member.summary: Indicates how characters print in a IBM 3151 emulation (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IbmPrintCharactersOption.National
member.summary: Prior to printing, the following characters are converted to spaces: linedraws; superscripts and subscripts; field and character attributes; reverse question marks; send marks; and control characters (0 to 31, and 127).

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IbmPrintCharactersOption.All
member.summary: Prior to printing, escape sequences initialize the print device and characters are translated.
member.remarks:
The following character translations occur:
Trailing nulls are omitted.
Control characters 0 to 31 are translated to spaces.
Field attributes are sent as a pair of character attributes.
Character attributes are sent prior to the associated character if the attribute changed between characters.
Reverse question marks are sent as spaces.
A sent mark is sent as a null.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IbmPrintCharactersOption.CharOnly
member.summary: Only ASCII characters between 32 and 126 are sent to the printer.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IbmprintLineTerminatorOption

member.summary: A carriage return is appended to each line.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IbmprintLineTerminatorOption.CRLF
member.summary: Both a carriage return and a line feed are appended to each line.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IbmprintPageTerminatorOption

member.summary: No end character is appended to the page end.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IbmprintPageTerminatorOption.FF
member.summary: A form feed character is appended to the page end.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IbmReceivedCROption.CRLF

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IbmReceivedLFOption.LFCR

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.LaunchApplicationAction
member.summary:
Starts an external application, if the required parameters are provided. This action requires the following three parameters (in order):
The complete path to the application executable file, of type string.
Optional arguments for the application's command line of type string. Specify an empty string if no arguments are necessary.
An optional working directory for the application of type string. Specify an empty string if no working directory is desired.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.OpenURLAction
member.summary:
Opens a URL, if the required parameters are provided. This action requires up to three parameters:
A URL string value (required).
An open location of type OpenUrlActionLocationOption (required). This determines how the URL opens (for example, via an external browser, a new Reflection tab, or an existing named Reflection tab).
The tab name of type string, if the second parameter is OpenUrlActionLocationOption.NamedTab.

member.summary: Prints the current document immediately. Requires no parameters.

member.summary: Starts or stops the Macro Recorder. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.GlobalSettingsAction
member.summary: Opens the Reflection Workspace global configuration settings. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.RunLegacyExtraMacroAction
member.summary:
Runs a legacy EXTRA! macro, if the required parameters are provided. This action requires two parameters:
The complete path to the EXTRA! macro file, of type string. This can be empty if the prompt at runtime flag is set to false.
A boolean value that determines whether the user is prompted for a macro to run at runtime. The first parameter value is ignored if this value is true.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.RunLegacyReflectionMacroAction
member.summary:
Runs a legacy Reflection macro, if the required parameters are provided. This action requires three parameters:
The name of the macro (type string),
Optional macro data (type string) to be passed to the macro at runtime. If no macro data is needed, this can be specified as an empty string.
A boolean value that determines whether the user is prompted for a macro to run at runtime. The first two parameter values are ignored if this value is true.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.RunMacroAction
member.summary:
Runs a macro, if the required parameters are provided. This action requires three parameters with an optional fourth parameter:
The macro name of type string (for example, "Module1.TestMacro"). Include the VBA project namespace in the name, if necessary.
The VBA project location where the macro is located (type MacroEnumerationOption). Specify MacroEnumerationOption.CommonProject if the macro is located in the Common project, or MacroEnumerationOption.Document if it's located in the current document's VBA project.
A boolean value that determines whether the user is prompted for a macro to run at runtime. The first two parameters are ignored if this value is true.
Optional macro data (type string) to be passed to the macro at runtime. If no macro data is needed, do not add this to the parameter list.

member.summary: Switches the visibility of the workspace Ribbon on and off. Requires no parammeters. This action does nothing if the workspace is running in Classic Mode.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.LayoutCascadeAction
member.summary: Rearranges all open document windows in the workspace to overlap in a cascade. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.StopMacroAction
member.summary: Stops the currently running macro, if any, in the current document. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.TogglePauseMacroAction
member.summary: Pauses or resumes recording a macro. Does nothing if a recording is not in progress. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.SetupLoggingAction
member.summary: Opens the logging configuration settings. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.StartLoggingAction
member.summary: Starts logging text from a host session to a printer or file. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.StopLoggingAction
member.summary: Stops logging if it is currently active. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.MacroSecurityAction
member.summary: Opens the API and Macro Security configuration settings. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.ClearDisplayAction
member.summary: Clears text from the cursor position to the end of the screen, without putting it on the Clipboard. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.ClearAllAction
member.summary: Clears all of the display memory without putting it on the Clipboard. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.StartTraceAction
member.summary: Opens the Start Trace dialog box, used to enter the name of the file in which to save the trace data. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.StopTraceAction
member.summary: Stops recording a trace. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.PlayBackTraceAction
member.summary: Opens the Playback Trace dialog box, used to open the file that contains the trace data. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.PreviousDocumentAction
member.summary: Make the previous session document or Web page active on an MDI workspace, whether you are viewing your documents as tabs or windows. Or make the next Workspace active if SDI mode is used. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.NextDocumentAction
member.summary: Make the next session document or Web page active on an MDI workspace, whether you are viewing your documents as tabs or windows. Or make the next Workspace active if SDI mode is used. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.QuickPadSettingsAction
member.summary: Opens the QuickPad configuration settings. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.ManageRibbonSettingsAction
member.summary: Opens the user interface settings for configuring the selected ribbon or classic UI mode file, modifying the current file, or creating a new file. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.RunSupportToolAction
member.summary: Runs a utility to help Attachmate Technical Support collect Reflection application data. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.RunHostExplorerMacroAction
member.summary:
Runs a HostExplorer macro. This action requires one parameter:
The full path to the HostExplorer macro file, of type string.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.DocumentPropertiesAction
member.summary: Displays document settings. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.ShowSpecificContextMenuAction
member.summary:
Shows a specified context menu.
This action requires four parameters:
The name of the context menu to show, of type string.
Whether to show the menu at the current mouse cursor position, of type bool.
The row in the host screen to show the menu at, of type int.
The column in the host screen to show the menu at, of type int.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.RunExternalLegacyReflectionMacroAction
member.summary:
Runs an external legacy Reflection macro. This requires four parameters:
The name of the macro (type string).
The name of the session file or external macro file (*.RMA) in which the macro resides (type string).
Optional macro data (type string) to be passed to the macro at runtime. If no macro data is needed, this can be specified as an empty string.
A boolean value that determines whether the user is prompted for a macro to run at runtime. The first three parameter values are ignored if this value is true.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.RunExternalLegacyReflectionBasicMacroAction
member.summary:
Runs an external legacy Reflection Basic Macro. This requires two parameters:
The name (type string) of the macro file (*.RBS).
Optional macro data (type string) to be passed to the macro at runtime. If no macro data is needed, this can be specified as an empty string.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.RunExternalLegacyReflectionRclScriptAction
member.summary:
Runs an external legacy Reflection Command Language (RCL) script. This requires one parameter:
The name (type string) of the RCL script file (*.RCL).

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.LayoutVerticalAction
member.summary: Rearranges all open document windows in the workspace to be tiled vertically. Requires no parameters.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapActionID.LayoutHorizontalAction
member.summary: Rearranges all open document windows in the workspace to be tiled horizontally. Requires no parameters.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.KeyboardMapper
member.summary: Provides the ability to view keyboard mappings for the terminal session, and to remap keys programmatically.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IKeyboardMapper
member.summary: Methods and properties associated with the terminal document's keyboard map.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IKeyboardMapper.AddMapping(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.KeyboardMapping)
member.summary: Adds a key mapping to the current keyboard map.
member.param: A mapping between a key sequence and a set of actions to perform when that key sequence is pressed in a host session.
member.remarks: A key can also be remapped to do nothing if the InputMapSequenceAction specified in mapping.Mapping has no InputMapActions added to it.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IKeyboardMapper.RemoveMapping(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Removes a key mapping from the keyboard map. This method should only be used to remove non-extended keys.
member.param: The key sequence for which to remove the mapping.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IKeyboardMapper.RemoveMapping(System.Windows.Forms.Keys,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes a key mapping from the keyboard map.
member.param: The key sequence for which to remove the mapping.

Indicates whether this key is an extended key. For IBM Enhanced 101-key and 102-key keyboards, extended keys are the right ALT and the right CTRL keys on the main section of the keyboard; the INS, DEL, HOME, END, PAGE UP, PAGE DOWN, and arrow keys in the clusters to the left of the numeric keypad; and the slash (/) and ENTER keys in the numeric keypad.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IKeyboardMapper.Contains(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Returns whether there is a mapping for a specified key combination in the current keyboard map. This method only works for non-extended keys.
member.param: The key sequence for which to query.
member.returns: True if the current keyboard map contains a mapping for key, false if not.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IKeyboardMapper.Contains(System.Windows.Forms.Keys,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns whether there is a mapping for a specified key combination in the current keyboard map.
member.param: The key sequence for which to query.

Indicates whether this key is an extended key. For IBM Enhanced 101-key and 102-key keyboards, extended keys are the right ALT and the right CTRL keys on the main section of the keyboard; the INS, DEL, HOME, END, PAGE UP, PAGE DOWN, and arrow keys in the clusters to the left of the numeric keypad; and the slash (/) and ENTER keys in the numeric keypad.
member.returns: True if the current keyboard map contains a mapping for key, false if not.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IKeyboardMapper.Save
member.summary: Saves changes to current keyboard map
member.exception: An I/O error occurred while trying to save the keyboard map.
The caller does not have the required permission to save the keyboard map.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IKeyboardMapper.SaveAs(System.String)
member.summary: Saves current keyboard map contents to a file
member.param: The path to the new keyboard map
member.exception: An I/O error occurred while trying to save the keyboard map.
The caller does not have the required permission to save the keyboard map.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IKeyboardMapper.KeyMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the keymap file.
member.remarks:
When setting the keymap file, if the value is not a full path, Reflection searches for the file in the user's Reflection document folder and in the Built-Ins/Keyboard Maps folder.
If the file isn't found or the full path that's passed in does not exist, a FileNotFoundException is thrown.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IKeyboardMapper.MappingCollection
member.summary: Returns a set of all the keys that have been remapped in the current keyboard map.

member.summary: Gets the parent object (IIbmTerminal).

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro
member.summary: Defines methods, properties, and events associated with running or recording macros in Reflection.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.ShowMacroDialog
member.summary: Displays the Run Macro dialog box.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.GetMacroNames(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ProjectOption)
member.summary: Gets a list of existing macro names.
member.param: The location from which to get the list of macro names. MacroEnumerationOption.Document gets a list of names from the session document's VBA project. MacroEnumerationOption.CommonProject gets a list of names from the Common VBA project.
member.returns: A set of macro names. The set may be empty if there are no existing macros.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.PasswordBox(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays a prompt for the Password dialog box.
member.param: The prompt string for the dialog box.
The dialog box caption.
member.returns: The string entered in the dialog's text box.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.RunMacro(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ProjectOption,System.String)
member.summary: Runs a macro.
member.param: The location of the macro. MacroEnumerationOption.Document indicates that the macro is located in the session document's VBA project. MacroEnumerationOption.Common indicates that the macro is located in the Common VBA project.
The name of the macro to run

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.RunMacro(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ProjectOption,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Runs a macro.
member.param: The location of the macro. MacroEnumerationOption.Document indicates that the macro is located in the session document's VBA project. MacroEnumerationOption.Common indicates that the macro is located in the Common VBA project.
The name of the macro to run.
An optional parameter to pass to the macro.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.RunMacro(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ProjectOption,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Runs a macro.
member.param: The location of the macro. MacroEnumerationOption.Document indicates that the macro is located in the session document's VBA project. MacroEnumerationOption.Common indicates that the macro is located in the Common VBA project.
The name of the macro to run.
An optional parameter to pass to the macro.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.StopMacro
member.summary: Stops a currently running macro.
member.remarks: This has no effect unless a macro is running in the current terminal session.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.StartMacroRecording
member.summary: Starts recording a macro in the current terminal session.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.StopMacroRecording(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.MacroDestinationOption,System.String)
member.summary: Stops the macro recorder in the current terminal session and saves the macro.
member.param: The location to which the macro is saved. MacroDestinationOption.Document saves the macro to the session document's VBA project. MacroDestinationOption.CommonProject saves the macro to the Common VBA project. MacroDestinationOption.Clipboard copies the macro script to the Windows Clipboard.
The name of the saved macro. This parameter is ignored if saveLocation is Clipboard.
member.exception: Thrown if the macro name is null, empty, or contains invalid characters.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.PauseRecording
member.summary: Pauses the macro recorder in the current terminal session.
member.remarks: This method is valid only when the macro recorder is running. It does nothing if the recorder is already paused.
member.exception: Thrown if the macro recorder is not currently recording.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.ResumeRecording
member.summary: Resumes recording a macro in the current terminal session.
member.remarks: This method is valid only when the macro recorder is running. It does nothing if the recorder is already active.
member.exception: Thrown if the macro recorder is not currently recording.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.RunLegacyReflectionMacro(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Runs a legacy Reflection macro.
member.param: Specifies the name of the macro to run. An error occurs if there is no macro with this name in the current settings file or in any referenced files. This value can be up to 255 characters long. If you have more than one macro with the same name in different files, precede the macro name with the project name and a period to correctly identify the macro. For example, "SharedMacros.Login" identifies the "Login" macro in the "SharedMacros" settings file.
An optional string to pass information to the macro.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.RunExternalLegacyReflectionMacro(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Runs a legacy Reflection macro that is not in the settings file in use for this session.
member.param: The path and name of the file that contains the macro you want to run. An error is returned if you specify an invalid or nonexistent file.
The macro you want to run. An error is returned if the macro does not exist.
An optional string to pass information to the macro.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.RunLegacyReflectionMacroFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Runs the legacy Reflection macro that is in the specified file.
member.param: The name of a macro file. Include the complete path if the macro file is not in the current folder.
An optional string to pass information to the macro.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.RunLegacyExtraMacro(System.String)
member.summary: Runs a legacy EXTRA! macro.
member.param: Specifies the full path of the macro to run.
member.exception: Thrown if the macro file does not exist.
member.remarks: Assumes that the EXTRA! Basic runtime is installed.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.RunHostExplorerMacro(System.String)
member.summary: Runs a HostExplorer acro.
member.param: Specifies the full path of the macro to run.
member.exception: Thrown if the macro file does not exist.
member.remarks: Assumes that the EXTRA! Basic runtime is installed.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent object (Terminal object).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.Recording
member.summary: Returns whether the macro recorder is currently recording.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.RecordingPaused
member.summary: Returns whether the macro recorder is currently paused.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.Script
member.summary: Gets the current macro recording script, if any. Returns String.Empty if no script is currently recording.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.Data
member.summary: Gets or specifies a string variable that can be used as data during macro execution.

value.para: The default value is "". This string can be up to 260 characters long.

member.exception: This exception is thrown if the set parameter is longer than the maximum allowed.

member.name: E:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.MacroStarted
member.summary: Raised when a Reflection macro has started. This does not apply to legacy Reflection macros or legacy EXTRA! macros.

member.name: E:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMacro.MacroCompleted
member.summary: Raised when a Reflection macro has completed. This does not apply to legacy Reflection macros or legacy EXTRA! macros.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMouseMapper.AddMapping(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.MouseMapping)
member.summary: Adds a mouse button mapping to the current mouse map.
member.param: An association between a mouse/key combination and a set of actions. The actions are performed when the mouse/key combination is pressed in a host session.
member.remarks: A mouse/key combination can be remapped to do nothing if the InputMapSequenceAction specified in mapping.Mapping has no InputMapActions added to it.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMouseMapper.RemoveMapping(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.MouseButtonCombination)
member.summary: Removes a mouse mapping from the mouse map.
member.param: The mouse/key combination for which to remove the mapping.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMouseMapper.Contains(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.MouseButtonCombination)
member.summary: Returns whether there is a mapping for a specified mouse/key combination in the current mouse map.
member.param: The mouse/key combination for which to query.
member.returns: True if the current keyboard map contains a mapping for key, false if not.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMouseMapper.MouseMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the mouse map file.
member.remarks:
When setting the mouse map file, if the value is not a full path, Reflection searches for the file in the user's Reflection document folder and in the Built-Ins/Keyboard Maps folder.
If the file cannot be found there, or the full path passed in does not exist, a FileNotFoundException is thrown.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMouseMapper.MappingCollection
member.summary: Returns a set of all mouse/key combinations that have been remapped in the current mouse map.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IMouseMapper.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent object (IIbmTerminal).

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.GetText(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the text from the specified location. The length argument specifies the number of screen bytes to get. In SBCS, the number of screen bytes is the same as that of the ScreenCharacter objects. In DBCS, the two numbers can be different. If the last byte is only one half byte of a DBCS character, the last byte is not returned.
member.param: starting row position
starting column position
number of text characters to retrieve
member.returns: the requested string
member.exception: This exception is thrown if the row or column parameters are outside the range of valid values (1 to Rows) or (1 to Columns).

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.GetText(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves text from the specified screen region. Text from the "wrapped" region is returned.
member.param: starting row position
starting column position
ending row position
ending column position

member.summary: Retrieves text from the specified screen region.
