member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.Selection
member.summary: Returns information about current selection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.ScreenSettleTime
member.summary: Gets or sets time duration during which there should be no host data changes. This value is used in triggering the ScreenReady event. The value is not persisted.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.SelectionMode
member.summary: Type of region selected.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.AbsoluteRow
member.summary: Returns or specifies how Reflection calculates the cursor row position shown in the status bar display. This property is only relevant if you are emulating a VT Terminal. When set to True, the cursor row position is calculated relative to the top of display memory, which means that the row value continues to increase as text scrolls off into display memory. When set to False, the cursor row position is calculated relative to the current screen display, which means it will never show a value greater than the current value of DisplayRows.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.AutoLinefeed
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether Reflection appends a linefeed character to each transmitted or received carriage return character . Most hosts echo both a carriage return and a linefeed when you press Return, so in remote mode it isn't usually appropriate to add another linefeed. In local mode, however, a carriage return does not execute a linefeed automatically, so you may want to set AutoLinefeed to True.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.AutoRepeat
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether keys repeat when you hold them down. The Shift, Enter, and Ctrl keys never auto repeat.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.AutoScroll
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether Auto Scroll is on. This property is valid for Wyse, DG, and ADDS terminal emulation. When this property is True, a linefeed on the last line of the screen causes a new blank line to be created and the rest of the screen to be scrolled up one line.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.BreakEnabled
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether a break can be transmitted to the host computer. This property affects breaks transmitted from the keyboard, and does not affect breaks transmitted programmatically (for example, with the Break method).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.BreakLength
member.summary: Returns or specifies the length (in milliseconds) of the break signal. Use the Break method to transmit a Break signal to the host.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.CapsLock
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether the CapsLock keyboard function is in effect. When this property is True, pressing any letter key transmits the uppercase version of the letter to the host. While the CapsLockMode property is True, the CapsLock property is automatically set to False.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.ColumnsPerScroll
member.summary: Returns or specifies the number of columns, or character positions, to be rolled right or left during one horizontal scrolling operation with Ctrl+Left or Ctrl+Right. In Reflection for HP, this property only applies when the RightMargin property is set to a value greater than 80. In Reflection for UNIX and OpenVMS and Reflection for ReGIS Graphics, this property only applies when RightMargin is greater than 80 and you are operating in graphics mode without a 132-column adapter.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.CompensateFrameSpaces
member.summary: Returns or specifies how Reflection handles spaces when aligning data on screen. This property is relevant for Thai character set support only; change the value of this property only if you are using the Thai version of Windows. If Reflection is using a proportional font, this property specifies the number of spaces after which text characters are realigned to display on monospaced boundaries. For example, if the terminal window is displaying two columns of data with at least three spaces between columns on any particular line, setting this property to 3 ensures that the second column of data is properly left-justified on the screen.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.CompressBlankLinesEnabled
member.summary: Returns or specifies how Reflection handles blank lines in display memory. When this property is True, Reflection compresses multiple blank lines in display memory into a single blank line. This property only affects lines that have scrolled off the screen.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.CopyDataFormat
member.summary: Returns or specifies the copy data format. Format can be Lines (the default), Unformatted or Paragraph.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.CopyTableMethod
member.summary: Returns or specifies the copy table method. The copy table method can be DetectColumns (based on vertical space alignment) or MultipleSpaces (which replaces multiple spaces or tabs with a single tab). The default is DetectColumns.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.CopyGraphicsBackground
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether bitmaps copied to the Clipboard are edited so the background color is set to white, and all near-white colors are set to black. This is useful for pasting graphic images into word processing documents.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.CopyGraphicsVGAColors
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether bitmaps copied to the Clipboard are dithered to standard VGA colors. (The dithering options are controlled by the ImageDither property.) This is useful for pasting graphic images into Windows applications that are not palette-aware (for example, Windows Paintbrush).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.CursorColumn
member.summary: Returns the column containing the cursor in the terminal window, relative to the left edge of the screen. The number is 1-based (the first column is column 1).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.CursorRow
member.summary: Returns the current cursor row in the terminal window, relative to the top of the screen, in host-addressable coordinates.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.DisplayColumns
member.summary: Returns or specifies the number of columns displayed in the terminal window.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.DisplayEnabled
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether Reflection displays characters received from the host during the execution of any of the following methods: ReadChars, ReadLine, or ReadUntil.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.DisplayMemoryBlocks
member.summary: Returns or specifies the number of 8K blocks allocated to display memory. Display memory contains both the information visible on the display and information that has scrolled off the display. It is a log of what has recently been sent from the host to the PC. This property determines the amount of memory you want to allocate to display memory. The default value is for 9 blocks of 8 kilobytes each, or 72K of display memory.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.DisplayMemoryTopRow
member.summary: Returns the index of the top row of display memory using host-addressable coordinates.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.DisplayRows
member.summary: Returns or specifies the number of lines in each page of display memory. The host can position the cursor and write characters on any row in the specified range.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.DrawingOptimization
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether Reflection uses drawing optimization features to control the timing of changes to the screen display. Use the default value (true) for the best performance with most host applications.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.DynamicTerminalSize
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether Reflection supports dynamic update of the number of rows and columns in the display when the user resizes the terminal window. Note: You can only set this property to True when you are emulating a VT terminal. Your Telnet server and application must also support NAWS (Negotiate About Window Size) otherwise display problems can occur. DynamicTerminalSize and AutoFontSize are mutually exclusive options. When one is set to True the other is automatically set to False.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.EndOfLineWrap
member.summary: This property returns or specifies what happens when typing reaches the end of a line. When this property is set to True, Reflection automatically inserts a carriage return and a linefeed when the cursor reaches the right margin. When the value is False, the cursor is not automatically advanced when it reaches the right marginas you type additional characters, each character overwrites the previous character until you move the cursor.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.ForceAutoRepeat
member.summary: When this property is set to True, Reflection ignores the current value of the AutoRepeat property and always auto repeats (causing most keys to repeat when you hold the key down).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.IbmIsBlockMode
member.summary: Returns or specifies the Block mode state for IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.IbmCharInsertionOption
member.summary: Returns or specifies how character insertion is handled during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151). When this property is True, a character insertion forces a character off a row (or off the end of the screen if Autowrap is on) when a character insertion operation is performed and a null character cannot be found to delete to accommodate the insertion.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.IbmLineInsertionOption
member.summary: Returns or specifies how line insertion is handled during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151). When this property is True, a line insertion forces the last line off the screen when a null line cannot be found to delete to accommodate the insertion.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.IbmClearModified
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether the Mdt (Modified data tag) is cleared after data is sent to the host during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.IbmIgnoreNull
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether nulls received from the host are ignored during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.IbmSendTrailingNulls
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether trailing nulls are sent to the host during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151). This property is only relevant in block mode.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.ImageUseCurrentColorMap
member.summary: Returns or specifies what happens when color bitmaps are pasted from the Clipboard. When this property is set to True, 256-color bitmaps pasted from the Clipboard are dithered to the current color map values. When this property is set to False, the color map that best represents the colors in the pasted bitmap is calculated. The dithering options are controlled by the ImageDither property.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.ImageColorMapFleshtonePriority
member.summary: Returns or specifies what happens when a 256-color image is pasted into the Reflection terminal window from the Clipboard. Because Reflection for ReGIS Graphics emulates a 16-color terminal, Reflection uses an algorithm to determine exactly how colors should be mapped. Setting ImageFleshtones to True causes Reflection to give more priority to accurately representing colors like red, brown, yellow, and pink from the original 256-color image, rather than to colors like blue and green.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.InactivityEventsIgnoreKeyboardMouse
member.summary: Returns or specifies how Reflection handles keyboard and mouse actions with events that are scheduled to execute after a period of inactivity. When this property is True (the default), mouse and keyboard activity are ignored, the period of inactivity is counted down, and the scheduled event is executed. When this property is False, keystrokes and mouse clicks reset the inactivity countdown when the Reflection terminal window has focus. Moving the mouse resets the inactivity countdown when Reflection is the foreground application.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.InsertMode
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether characters can be added to text in the terminal window without typing over existing characters. When this property is set to False, typing over existing characters replaces those characters. When this property is set to True, new characters are inserted at the cursor location, and existing characters are moved to the right. This property is relevant when Reflection is in block mode.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.ReverseVideo
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether the foreground and background colors for screen attributes are reversed.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.IsJISRoman
member.summary: This property returns or specifies how character 92 is displayed by default when HostCharacterSet is set to rcDECKanji1983 or rcDECKanji1978. When this property is set to True, by default Reflection displays character 92 as a Yen character and the character set in G0 is JIS-Roman. When this parameter is set to False, by default Reflection displays character 92 as a backslash character ( \ ) and the character set in G0 is ASCII instead of JIS-Roman.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.UseKatakanaCharacterSet
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether the Katakana or Kanji character set is used by default when HostCharacterSet is set to rcDECKanji1983 or rcDECKanji1978. When this property is set to True, Reflection uses the Katakana character set as the default. When this property is set to False, Reflection uses the Kanji character set as the default.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.IsKeyboardLocked
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether or not the keyboard and the toolbar are locked (that is, they cannot be used). When this property is set to True, the keyboard and toolbar cannot be used.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.MaintainUnscaledImage
member.summary: By default, Reflection scales graphics images down so that an entire image fits on the PC display. Set this property to True if you want to see an image as it would appear on a terminal display. Use Alt with the arrow keys to pan the window.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.MarginClickSelectsLine
member.summary: Returns or specifies how Reflection responds to a mouse click in the left margin of the terminal window. When this property is true (the default) a mouse click selects the entire line. When it is false, a click in the left margin is equivalent to a click in the first column and does not select any text.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.MarginBellEnabled
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether a bell should sound when the cursor reaches the column that is eight spaces short of the right margin.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.MouseColumn
member.summary: Returns the column location where the mouse was last clicked within the terminal screen. A click in the first column sets this property to zero (0).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.MouseRow
member.summary: Returns the row location, in host-addressable coordinates, where the mouse was last clicked within the terminal screen.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.MultiplePageTerminal
member.summary: With Reflection, your PC can emulate a multi-page terminal that dynamically stores data. But some applications designed for Digital terminals require that the terminal have only a single page of memory (24 lines). If you're running a host application that requires single-page mode, set this property to False.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.NumLock
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether the NumLock keyboard function is on or off. When this property is True, keypad keys are in numeric mode; when it's False, keypad keys are in cursor-positioning mode.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.OnDemandFontsEnabled
member.summary: On-demand font-loading (ODL) is a Digital Japan feature that has been added to version 5.2 of Reflection (along with related features such as VT382 font-preloading and Gyoukan-Keisen line drawing). Set this property to True if you are using an EUC double-byte Japanese character set and want ODL to be used for xA121-xFE7E.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.PageCoupling
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether the cursor is coupled to the current page in page memory or whether moving the cursor to another page automatically causes that page to be displayed.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.PasteBufferSize
member.summary: Returns or specifies the size of a "paste block," which is the number of characters pasted from the Clipboard to the terminal window before a pause occurs. See the description for the PasteDelay property for information on configuring the length of the pause and on conditions that can terminate the pause.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.PasteDelay
member.summary: Returns or specifies how many tenths of a second Reflection is to wait between "paste blocks" when pasting data from the Clipboard into display memory. (See the description for the PasteBufferSize property for information on configuring the size of a paste block.) In Reflection for UNIX and OpenVMS and Reflection for ReGIS Graphics, Reflection waits either for the PasteDelay interval or for the number of characters already sent to be echoed back before sending another line.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.WyseDelKeyAsDestructiveBackspace
member.summary: Returns or specifies how a DEL character is handled. When this property is True, a DEL character is interpreted as a destructive backspace. This property is valid only during Wyse terminal emulation.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.ReGISMoveMouse
member.summary: Returns or specifies what happens to the ReGIS cursor when you move the Windows mouse to a location in the Reflection terminal window that is different from the position the host has established. To disable this feature and enable the ability to "click ahead," change the setting of ReGISMoveMouse to False.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.ReGISRestoreTextColors
member.summary:
Returns or specifies whether Reflection restores text colors after ReGIS graphics have been drawn. When this property is set to True, colors are temporarily saved by Reflection when all three of the following events occur:
Reflection is placed into ReGIS mode by a graphics application. The application changes your colors.
A ReGIS or sixel image is drawn on the screen.
Text colors are then restored when either of the following occurs:
The entire screen is cleared (with the sequence H, J, or 2J).
The application exits ReGIS mode and the entire image scrolls off the screen (for example, as the result of a series of characters).
This behavior differs from an actual terminal, where your original colors are never restored when changed by a graphics application. If colors were changed in ReGIS but no graphics were drawn, the original colors are not restored. This preserves the intent of some text applications that use ReGIS to change screen colors.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.SavePageOnClear
member.summary: Returns or specifies what happens to the data on screen when the host clears the display. Applications running on the host often send down escape sequences to clear the screen in whole or in part. When the screen is cleared, the data that was displayed is lost. This property allows you to retain the data that would otherwise be lost. When this property is set to True and such an escape sequence is received, the current display is cleared from view and saved in display memory, and the cursor is positioned at the top of the screen.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.ScreenTopRow
member.summary: Returns the row number of the top row of the screen, in host-addressable coordinates. The ScreenTopRow value is always zero unless Reflection is emulating an HP terminal. When Reflection is emulating an HP host terminal, the value is equal to the number of rows of display memory above what the host would consider to be the top row on the screen. This can be different from the top row that is visible in the window if the user has scrolled using the scroll bar.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.ShowControlCharacters
member.summary: When this property is set to True, Reflection displays control characters but does not execute the functions these characters would otherwise perform.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.SlashZeros
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether zeros displayed in the terminal window contain slashes (like this: ). This property only affects the terminal window and has no effect on HP Function key labels, the Terminal's status line, menus, dialog boxes, the Windows Clipboard, or printing. It also has no effect on fonts that, by their design, already display zeroes with slashes (for example, the Terminal font). When this property is True, text displayed in the terminal window uses the slash zero. When it is False (the default), the standard zero character is used.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.SmoothScroll
member.summary: Returns or specifies the scroll speed setting. When this property is set to True, data from the host scrolls more slowly and evenly. (Changing this value to True is equivalent to changing the Scrolling option on the Screen tab of the Display Setup dialog box to Smooth.)

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.TransmitXonXoffEnabled
member.summary: When this property is set to False, the Ctrl+S keystroke executes the hold screen keyboard function, and the Ctrl+Q keystroke cancels the hold screen; neither keystroke actually transmits anything to the host. When TransmitXonXoff is set to True, Ctrl+S and Ctrl+Q are transmitted, and the hold screen function is not invoked. This property is automatically set to True when TerminalType is set to rcANSIBBS or rcANSIUNIX; it is automatically set to False when the value of TerminalType is changed from rcANSIBBS or rcANSIUNIX to any other value.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.TVIAttributeSpaceEnabled
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether a visual attribute should or should not occupy a character space in display memory when Reflection is emulating a TVI terminal (TerminalType = rcTVI955). When this property is False, visual attributes in display memory do not occupy a character space. When it is True, a visual attribute will occupy a character space in display memory.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.UseAnsiColor
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether the host can transmit ANSI color sequences to Reflection, thereby changing the foreground and background colors for characters displayed in the terminal window. This property applies to the display of ANSI color sequences in Reflection; it does not apply to printing with Reflection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.VerticalCoupling
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether the row in which the cursor is located remains in the terminal window regardless of how the terminal window is resized or which screen font size is used.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.ClearDisplayOnWidthChangeEnabled
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether the screen display is cleared when the number of screen columns is changed. The number of screen columns can be specified using either the DisplayColumns property or the Screen tab in the Display Setup dialog box.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.WordSelectionBoundaryExclusive
member.summary: Returns or specifies a string of characters that mark the beginning or end of a "word" when using a mouse to select words in the terminal window. These "exclusive" characters are not included in the word that is selected.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.WordSelectionBoundaryInclusive
member.summary: Returns or specifies a string of characters that mark the beginning or end of a word when using a mouse to select words in the terminal window. These "inclusive" characters are included as part of the word that is selected.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.WyseBlockMode
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether a Wyse terminal is in Block Mode. The value of this property is not saved to a settings file.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.WyseLabelLines
member.summary: Returns or specifies how many label lines are visible. The terminal decides how many label lines are visible by how many display rows are requested. Reflection allows you to always have two if you want. If only one label line is visible, pressing the Shift key will display the second line. This property is valid only during Wyse terminal emulation.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.WyseProtectMode
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether the terminal is in Protect Mode. In Protect Mode, the cursor is not allowed to move into areas of the screen that are write-protected. Cursor movement keys and the tab and backtab keys move from one unprotected area to the next unprotected area. This property is valid only during Wyse terminal emulation. The value of this property is not saved to a settings file.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.IbmEnterKey
member.summary: Returns or specifies how the Enter key behaves during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.IbmInsertion
member.summary: Returns or specifies the behavior of the Insert Key during 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.IbmReceivedCR
member.summary: Returns or specifies how a received carriage return is interpreted during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.IbmReceivedLF
member.summary: Returns or specifies how a received line feed is interpreted during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.IbmReturnKey
member.summary: Returns or specifies the behavior of the Return key during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.IbmSendKey
member.summary: Returns or specifies how the Send key behaves during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.IbmTabKey
member.summary: Returns or specifies how the Tab key behaves during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.IbmTurnAroundChar
member.summary: Returns or specifies defines the LineTurnAround (LTA) character for IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.ImageDither
member.summary: Returns or specifies what happens when a 256-color image is pasted into the Reflection terminal window from the Clipboard. Because Reflection for ReGIS Graphics emulates a 16-color terminal, Reflection uses an algorithm to determine exactly how colors should be mapped. Try all three values to see which works best for a particular image.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.JumpScrollSpeed
member.summary: Returns or specifies how Reflection manages data entering display memory. Setting JumpScrollSpeed to rcScrollBy1 refreshes the screen every time a line enters display memory. Higher numerical values (rcScrollBy2, rcScrollBy4, and so on, up to rcScrollBy128) refresh the screen after the specified number of lines have entered display memoryassuming data is entering display memory too fast for the display to keep up.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.WyseReceivedCR
member.summary: Returns or specifies how a received carriage return (CR) is interpreted. This property is valid only during Wyse terminal emulation.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.ScrollOptimization
member.summary: Returns or specifies when Reflection uses an off-screen bitmap to speed up scrolling. With most EGA and VGA video adapters, it's usually more efficient to use this off-screen bitmap, but with video adapters that support higher resolutions and more colors, it may be more efficient not to use the bitmap. When this property is set to rcAuto, Reflection automatically adjusts to either use or not use the off-screen bitmap, depending on the capabilities of the video adapter.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.TektronixDefaultFontSize
member.summary: Returns or specifies the default font size for Tektronix emulation.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.TVIAttributeBaseMode
member.summary: Returns or specifies how visual attributes are applied when Reflection is emulating a TVI terminal (TerminalType = rcTVI955).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.TVIBottomStatusLine
member.summary: Returns or specifies usage and display of the bottom status line when Reflection is emulating a TVI terminal (TerminalType = rcTVI955).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.TVICompatibility
member.summary: Returns or specifies which TVI emulation type Reflection uses when TerminalType is set to rcTVI955.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.TVIDownKeySends
member.summary: Returns or specifies the action of the Down key when Reflection is emulating a TVI terminal (TerminalType = rcTVI955).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.TVIFunctionKeySet
member.summary: Returns or specifies which function key set is available to the keyboard when Reflection is emulating a TVI terminal (TerminalType = rcTVI955).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.TVIStatusLineAttribute
member.summary: Returns or specifies how the top and bottom status line appear in Reflection's terminal window when Reflection is emulating a TVI terminal (TerminalType = rcTVI955).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.TVITopStatusLine
member.summary: Returns or specifies usage and display of the top status line when Reflection is emulating a TVI terminal (TerminalType = rcTVI955).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.VTBackspaceSends
member.summary: Returns or specifies what is transmitted to the host when the user press the Backspace key. On the VT terminal keyboard the backarrow key is configurable: it can send either a delete (ASCII 127) or a backspace (ASCII 8) character. In Reflection, use this property to configure Backspace in the same manner. This property affects Reflection for HP only in VT emulation mode.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.VTCursorKey
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether the cursor keys are under host control. This property is usually controlled by the host. If you find that your arrow keys aren't working properly, it may mean that this option was incorrectly left set to rcApplicationMode when a host program terminated abnormally. This property affects Reflection for HP only in VT emulation mode.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.VTKeyPad
member.summary: Returns or specifies which characters are transmitted by the numeric keypad keys. This property is normally controlled by the host. If you find that the keypad number or PF keys aren't working properly, it may mean that this option was incorrectly left set to rcApplicationMode when a host program terminated abnormally. This property affects Reflection for HP only in VT emulation mode.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.WyseAttribute
member.summary: Returns or specifies the Wyse terminal display attribute mode. This property is valid only for Wyse terminal emulation.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.WyseBlockTerminator
member.summary: Returns or specifies the end-of-transmission delimiter for block sends. This is typically set by the host application. This property is valid only during Wyse terminal emulation.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.WyseEnterKey
member.summary: Returns or specifies what is sent to the host when the Enter key is pressed. This property is valid only during Wyse terminal emulation.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.WyseReturnKey
member.summary: Returns or specifies what is sent to the host when the Return key is pressed. This property is valid only during Wyse terminal emulation.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreen.WyseStatusLineDisplay
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether the Wyse status line at the top of the screen is set to Off, Standard, or Edit.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreenPrivateAPI
member.summary: An extension to the IScreen interface specifically for elements that we wish to implement in VBA/COM that we do not want to make available via the .Net API.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreenPrivateAPI.DefineEvent(System.Int32,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.DefinedEventType,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Defines a specific event
member.param: The integer value used as an identifier for this event. If the value is set to 0, a value is automatically assigned.
The event type being defined.
Mandatory for EventTypes that require a String parameter, otherwise ignored.
The screen row position (the first row = 1). Mandatory for EventTypes that require a Row parameter, otherwise ignored.
The screen column position (the first column = 1). Mandatory for EventTypes that require a Column parameter, otherwise ignored.
member.returns: Assigned event number

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreenPrivateAPI.RemoveEvent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a specific event that was defined via DefineEvent.
member.param: integer designating the event to remove

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.IScreenPrivateAPI.ClearEvents
member.summary: Removes all events defined via DefineEvent.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal
member.summary: The Terminal is an Open Systems host emulation session object.
member.remarks: The control Guid for non graphics terminal is {BE835A80-CAB2-40d2-AFC0-6848E486BF58}. The control Guid for ReGIS Graphics terminal is {C62BA7E4-5A20-4681-931B-07BF7C971D13}. These Guids are used as the input parameters for CreateControl( Guid controlType) in the Application object.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.Execute(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapAction)
member.summary: Execute a given action. Actions possible is defined in InputMapActionID.
member.param: The action to be executed.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates the success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.CloseAllConnections
member.summary: Closes all connections established by the current copy of Reflection.
member.remarks: This method disconnects the current connection (if any) and any suspended connections previously established. This method does not affect connections opened by other copies of Reflection.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.Connect
member.summary: Connects to the host. It is ignored if a connection already exists.
member.remarks: Use the IsConnected property to determine if a connection already exists. Use HostCommTimeout to specify how many seconds Reflection waits for a host response.
member.returns: Connection Status

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.Dial(System.String)
member.summary: Dials a modem. This method is only valid if Reflection is set to use the old modem dialer (UseModemDialerV5 = true).
member.remarks: Dials a modem with default initialization string one time.
member.param: The phone number to dial. The string can contain any valid modem dialing characters, such as commas (to allow dialing to pause for two seconds per comma) and hyphens and parentheses (used as separators for better readability). The string should not include any AT commands or dialing prefix commands.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.Dial(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.SpeakerOption,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.SpeakerVolumeOption,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dials a modem. This method is only valid if Reflection is set to use the old modem dialer (UseModemDialerV5 = true).
member.param: The phone number to dial. The string can contain any valid modem dialing characters, such as commas (to allow dialing to pause for two seconds per comma) and hyphens and parentheses (used as separators for better readability). The string should not include any AT commands or dialing prefix commands.
Description to be displayed in the Dialing In Progress dialog box. If this option is omitted, only the phone number appears in the dialog box.
String to be sent to the modem before dialing. If omitted, Reflection uses the default initialization string.

Specifies the amount of time to wait for the host to confirm the connection. The string is specified in HH:MM:SS.hh format. A time string of "0" causes Reflection to wait indefinitely. If this is empty (""), the default timeout (60 seconds) is used.
Specifies the number of times to redial if the number is busy or does not answer. Default value should be one retry.
Specifies the amount of time to wait before redialing. The string is specified in HH:MM:SS.hh format. If this argument is empty (""), the default timeout is used (120 seconds).
Specifies the speaker mode. The default is Dialing.
Specifies the speaker volume. The default is Medium.
If true, the modem speaker is turned off after the first dialing attempt. If false (the default) or omitted, the modem speaker remains set to the SpeakerMode for each dialing attempt.
If true, Reflection ignores modem initialization string errors. If false, these errors are displayed in a message box.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects from the host. If no connection currently exists, this method is ignored.
member.remarks: Use the IsConnected property to determine if a connection already exists.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.Close(Attachmate.Reflection.CloseOption)
member.summary: Closes the terminal session with the close option.

param.name: option

span.style: FONT-FAMILY: 'Verdana','sans-serif'; COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA

param.span: Specifies how to handle the Save action when closing the control.

member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.StopTerminalInstance
member.summary: For internal use. Used when a Terminal User Control is being shut down.
member.returns: ReturnCode indicating success or failure.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.GetSerialConnectionStatistics(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionStatisticOption)
member.summary: Returns a statistic for a serial connection.
member.remarks: If the connection is not a serial connection, or if there is not connection, GetSerialStatistics returns -1. Statistics are maintained from the time a connection is established or from when the terminal session is reset (for example, with the ResetTerminal method).
member.param: Specifies which statistics to return.
member.returns: The requested statistic if the ConnectionType is a serial connection, or -1 if it is not.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.HangUp
member.summary: Hangs up the modem by sending the Hayes "+++" command to get the modem's attention, followed by the "ATH" hangup command.
member.remarks:
This method does not guarantee that the modem has actually hung up. No error is returned if the method fails for any reason. After the modem is hung up, the port remains open; use the Disconnect method to close the port.
Valid only if Reflection is set to use the old modem dialer (UseModemDialerV5 = true).

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.OpenSettings(System.String)
member.summary: Opens a setting file.
member.param: Specifies the path and filename for the settings file.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.StartTrace(System.String,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.TraceFileExistsOption,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.TraceFormatOption)
member.summary: Starts capturing data coming from the host to a disk file.
member.param: Specifies the file to which data is written.
Specifies what to do if the file already exists. The default is OpenError.
Specifies what kind of trace to perform. The default is TraceDefault.
member.remarks: Data being transmitted to the host can also be captured. The captured data includes all escape sequences and control codes, but does not include flow control, such as Xon/Xoff characters. The data is captured in binary format and is not translated in any way.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.WaitForCall
member.summary: Initializes the modem to automatically answer an incoming call and opens a status dialog box until a connection is established.
member.remarks: This method does not check to see whether a modem is actually connected to the serial port. It simply transmits the Hayes "AT" command to get the modem's attention, and then transmits the "ATS0=1" command to place the modem in answer mode. If the command fails for any reason, no error is returned. The procedure continues to the next statement only after the status box is dismissed (either because the modem established a connection, the user canceled, or the dialog box timed out).
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.WaitForCall(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the modem to automatically answer an incoming call and opens a status dialog box until a connection has been established.
member.remarks: This method does not check to see whether a modem is actually connected to the serial port. It simply transmits the Hayes "AT" command to get the modem's attention, and then transmits the "ATS0=1" command to place the modem in answer mode. If the command fails for any reason, no error is returned. The procedure continues to the next statement only after the status box is dismissed (either because the modem established a connection, the user canceled, or the dialog box timed out).
member.param: Specifies a message to be displayed in the Waiting for Call dialog box.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.WaitForCall(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the modem to automatically answer an incoming call and opens a status dialog box until a connection has been established.
member.remarks: This method does not check to see whether a modem is actually connected to the serial port. It simply transmits the Hayes "AT" command to get the modem's attention, and then transmits the "ATS0=1" command to place the modem in answer mode. If the command fails for any reason, no error is returned. The procedure continues to the next statement only after the status box is dismissed (either because the modem established a connection, the user canceled, or the dialog box timed out).
member.param: Specifies a message to be displayed in the Waiting for Call dialog box.
Specifies an initialization string to be sent to the modem before waiting.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.summary: Issues a request to the Reflection Security Gateway for a DASO pass ticket. On success, the DASOUserID and DASOPassTicket properties will be valid and can be used for automated sign on to the host. The application ID can be preset using the DASOApplicationID property in which case the ApplicationID parameter on this call may be empty.
member.param: The host application ID.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicate success or error conditions.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.TerminalUserControlContext
member.summary: This is an internal property used to determine the context of this terminal object usage. This is set to true if this terminal object is being used in a Terminal User Control context.
member.remarks: The default is false.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.AllowJIS
member.summary: Gets or sets whether JIS escape sequences are allowed when other host character sets are selected.
member.remarks: When this property is false, JIS characters display only when a JIS mode (JIS 1978, JIS 1983, JIS 1990, or JIS Katakana) is selected. When it is true, JIS escape sequences are allowed when other Japanese character sets (such as EUC or SJIS) are selected.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.AnswerBack
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that is sent to the host when Reflection receives an Enq character from the host.
member.remarks: When EnqAck is set to true, Reflection sends an Ack character in response to an Enq from the host, and the value of AnswerBack is ignored. This property is relevant only when the EnqAck property is set to false.
member.value: The default value is "". The string cannot be more than 30 characters long.
member.exception: Thrown if the set parameter is too long for the current terminal type.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.AutoAnswerback
member.summary: Get or set whether the answerback message (set with the AnswerBack property) is automatically sent to the host after a communications line connection.
member.value: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.AutoConnect
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifes whether to attempt to establish a host connection as soon as the current settings file is loaded.
member.remarks: You must save the current settings file after changing the value of this property. This property causes an error when Reflection is connected to a host. Use the IsConnected property to determine if a connection already exists.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.BellEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a bell sounds when the ASCII bell character (decimal 7) is transmitted from the keyboard or received from the host.
member.value: The default value is true.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.BlockTerminator
member.summary: Gets or sets a block terminator character to be transmitted at the end of each block data transmission.
member.value: The default value is Chr$(rcSUB). Only ANSI characters with values from 0 to 31 are valid for this property.
member.exception: Thrown if the set parameter is outside the range of valid values.

summary.para: Gets or sets whether Reflection caches the user name entered for a Secure Shell session.

remarks.para: When this property is true (the default), the user name is saved in memory until the Reflection workspace is closed. Users are not prompted for a user name when they reconnect unless they reopen the workspace.
When this property is false, the user name is cleared from memory immediately after a successful connection is established and users are prompted for a user name when they reconnect.
This property is relevant only when ConnectionType = "SECURE SHELL".

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.CitrixPCName

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.CitrixUserName

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.ClearDisplayOnDisconnect
member.summary: Get or set how Reflection handles the display memory when you disconnect from the host.
member.remarks: When this property is true, Reflection clears the screen after disconnecting from the host. When it is false, data in the display memory is retained.
member.value: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ITerminal.CodePage
