member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.UseIPv6Option
member.summary: Defines how Reflection communicates with a host using the IPv6 and older IPv4 protocols.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.UseIPv6Option.WhenAvailable
member.summary: Reflection connects using IPv6 if it is available. If IPv6 is not available, Reflection attempts to connect using IPv4.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.UseIPv6Option.Always
member.summary: Reflection only attempts an IPv6 connection.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.UseIPv6Option.Never
member.summary: Reflection never attempts an IPv6 connection.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.VTBackspaceSendsOption
member.summary: Indicates the key that is transmitted to the host when the user presses the BACKSPACE key.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.VTBackspaceSendsOption.DeleteKey
member.summary: The Delete character is transmitted when the user presses the Backspace key.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.VTBackspaceSendsOption.BackspaceKey
member.summary: The Backspace character is transmitted when the user presses the Backspace key.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.VTCursorKeyOption
member.summary: Denotes whether the cursor keys are controlled by the host.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.VTCursorKeyOption.NormalMode
member.summary: Cursor keys are in normal mode.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.VTCursorKeyOption.ApplicationMode
member.summary: Cursor keys are defined and controlled by the host application.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.VTKeyPadOption
member.summary: Indicates which characters are transmitted by the numeric keypad keys.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.VTKeyPadOption.NumericMode
member.summary: Keys on the numeric keypad are in normal (numeric) mode.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.VTKeyPadOption.ApplicationMode
member.summary: Keys on the numeric keypad are defined by the host application.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WaitForOption.None
member.summary: No options.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WaitForOption.AllowKeystrokes
member.summary: Allows keystrokes while a wait is in progress.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WaitForOption.NoDisplay
member.summary: Does not display incoming text while a wait is in progress.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WaitForOption.NoTranslation
member.summary: The specified string contains binary data which matches exactly what the host receives without any host-to-PC character conversion.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WaitForOption.HexData
member.summary: Portions of the specified string following a backslash are interpreted using either hexadecimal code or C-language character conventions.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WRQCompressionOption
member.summary: Options for specifying how file compression is handled.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WRQCompressionOption.None
member.summary: Performs no compression on transfers.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WRQCompressionOption.Rle
member.summary: Performs run-length compression on transfers.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WRQCompressionOption.Huffman
member.summary: Performs Huffman compression on transfers.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WRQFastFileTransferOption
member.summary: Options for specifying whether Reflection uses the fast file transfer feature.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WRQFastFileTransferOption.Negotiate
member.summary: Reflection attempts a fast file transfer. If the fast file transfer feature is not available, a standard transfer is used.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WRQFastFileTransferOption.Always
member.summary: Fast file transfer is always used.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WRQFastFileTransferOption.Never
member.summary: Fast file transfer is never used.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WRQMPEFileNamesOption
member.summary: Specifies which MPE operating system naming convention to use.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WRQMPEFileNamesOption.Mpe
member.summary: Reflection uses traditional MPE filenames unless a name begins with a forward slash or a period, in which case the name is assumed to be a POSIX name.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WRQMPEFileNamesOption.MpeOnly
member.summary: Reflection uses traditional MPE filenames, reporting any filename beginning with a forward slash or a period as invalid.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WRQMPEFileNamesOption.Posix
member.summary: Reflection uses POSIX filenames.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WRQMPEFileNamesOption.Auto
member.summary: The host program determines which naming system to use.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseAttributeOption
member.summary: Indicates the Wyse terminal display attribute mode.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseAttributeOption.Character
member.summary: Character mode, which adds the current display attribute to each character as it is received, exactly like a VT emulator.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseAttributeOption.Line
member.summary: Line mode, which adds the newly specified display attribute to every subsequent character on the line immediately, up to the end of the line or the next different attribute.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseAttributeOption.Page
member.summary: Page mode, which adds the newly specified attribute to every character on the page or up to the next existing attribute.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseBlockTerminatorOption
member.summary: Indicates the end-of-transmission delimiter for block sends for Wyse terminal emulation sessions.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseBlockTerminatorOption.USCR
member.summary: Sends a US at the end of a line and a carriage return (CR) at the end of a page or block.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseBlockTerminatorOption.CRETX
member.summary: Sends a carriage return (CR) at the end of a line and an ETX at the end of a page.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseEnterKeyOption
member.summary: Indicates what is sent to the host when the ENTER key is pressed during a Wyse terminal emulation session.
member.remarks: The selected character or character sequence is sent.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseEnterKeyOption.CR
member.summary: Send a carriage return (CR).

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseEnterKeyOption.CRLF
member.summary: Send a carriage return and line feed (CRLF).

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseEnterKeyOption.TAB
member.summary: Send a TAB.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseReceivedCROption
member.summary: Indictates how a received carriage return (CR) is interpreted during a Wyse terminal emulation session.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseReceivedCROption.CR
member.summary: Interpret as a carriage return (CR).

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseReceivedCROption.CRLF
member.summary: Interpret as a carriage return followed by a linefeed (CRLF).

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseReturnKeyOption
member.summary: Indictates what is sent to the host when the RETURN key is pressed during a Wyse terminal emulation session.
member.remarks: The selected character or character sequence is sent.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseReturnKeyOption.CR
member.summary: Send a carriage return (CR).

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseReturnKeyOption.CRLF
member.summary: Send a carriage return and line feed (CRLF).

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseReturnKeyOption.TAB
member.summary: Send a TAB.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseStatusLineDisplayOption
member.summary: Indicates whether the Wyse status line at the top of the screen is set to Off, Standard, or Edit.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseStatusLineDisplayOption.Standard
member.summary: The Wyse status line is visible.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseStatusLineDisplayOption.Off
member.summary: The Wyse status line is not visible.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.WyseStatusLineDisplayOption.Edit
member.summary: The Wyse status line is equivalent to Standard.

member.summary: Specifies the operation to perform when a file already exists.

member.summary: Overwrite the file.

member.summary: Append the file.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.XModemErrorCheckingOption

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.GetText(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the text from the specified location.
member.remarks: The length argument specifies the number of screen bytes to get. In a single-byte character set (SBCS), the number of screen bytes is the same as that of the ScreenCharacter objects. In a double-byte character set (DBCS), the two numbers can be different. If the last byte is only half of a DBCS character, the last byte is not returned.
member.param: The starting row position.
The starting column position.
The number of text characters to retrieve.
member.returns: The requested string.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if the row or column parameters are outside the range of valid values: (1 to Rows) or (1 to Columns).

member.param: The starting row position.

member.summary: Waits for the host screen data to settle (that is, there is no incoming data for the specified settle time).
member.param: Settle time.

member.remarks: The wait timeout value should be greater than settleTime.
member.param: wait timeout value (milliseconds). Value of 0 indicates wait indefinitely.
Settle time.
member.returns: ReturnCode that indicates the success or failure status.

member.remarks: The wait timeout value should be greater than settleTime.

Specifies whether the keyboard is enabled while the call executes.

wait timeout value (milliseconds). Value of 0 indicates wait indefinitely.

member.returns: ReturnCode that indicates the success or failure status.

member.param: wait timeout value (milliseconds). Value of 0 indicates wait indefinitely.
member.returns: ReturnCode that indicates the success or failure status.

member.summary: Waits for any data to come from the host.
member.param: wait timeout value (milliseconds). Value of 0 indicates wait indefinitely.
Specifies whether the keyboard is enabled while the call executes.

member.param: The text to wait for.

Valid options for this method are AllowKeystrokes, NoDisplay, and None.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.GetCharacterAttributes(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves character attributes for the specified position.
member.param: The screen row position.
The screen column position.
member.returns: Attribute information for the specified position. May specify multiple attributes.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.GetCharacter(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the ScreenCharacter at the specified location.
member.param: The screen row position.
The screen column position.
member.returns: ScreenCharacter for the specified position.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if the row or column parameters are outside the range of valid values: (1 to Rows) or (1 to Columns).

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.GetCharacters(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets ScreenCharacter objects from the specified location, each representing one character at a screen location.
member.remarks: The length argument specifies the number of screen bytes to get. In single-byte character sets (SBCS), the number of screen bytes is the same as that of ScreenCharacter objects. In double-byte character sets (DBCS), the two numbers can be different. If the last byte is only half of a DBCS character, the last byte is not returned.
member.param: The screen row position.
The screen column position.
The number of characters to obtain.
member.returns: Array of ScreenCharacter for the specified position.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if the row or column parameters are outside the range of valid values: (1 to Rows) or (1 to Columns).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.AbsoluteRow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how Reflection calculates the cursor row position shown in the status bar display for VT emulations only.
member.remarks:
When set to true, the cursor row position is calculated relative to the top of display memory. (that is, the row value increases as text scrolls off into display memory).
When set to false, the cursor row position is calculated relative to the current screen display (that is, the row value is never greater than the current value of DisplayRows).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.AutoLinefeed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Reflection appends a linefeed character to each transmitted or received carriage return character.
member.remarks: Most hosts echo both a carriage return and a linefeed when you press the Return key, so it isn't usually appropriate to add another linefeed in remote mode. However, in local mode, a carriage return does not execute a linefeed automatically, so you may want to set AutoLinefeed to true.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.AutoRepeat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether keys repeat when you hold them down. (The SHIFT, ENTER, and CTRL keys never auto repeat.)

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.AutoScroll
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Auto Scroll is on.
member.remarks:
This property is valid for Wyse, DG, and ADDS terminal emulation.
When this property is true, a linefeed on the last line of the screen causes a new blank line to be created and the rest of the screen to scroll up one line.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.BreakEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a break can be transmitted to the host computer.
member.remarks: This property affects breaks transmitted from the keyboard, not breaks transmitted programmatically (for example, with the Break method).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.BreakLength
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the length (in milliseconds) of the break signal.
member.remarks: To transmit a Break signal to the host, use the Break method.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.CapsLock
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the CapsLock keyboard function is in effect.
member.remarks: When this property is true, pressing any letter key transmits the uppercase version of the letter to the host. (If the CapsLockMode property is true, the CapsLock property is automatically set to false.)

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.ColumnsPerScroll
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the number of columns, or character positions, to roll right or left during one horizontal scrolling operation with CTRL+Left or CTRL+Right.
member.remarks: This property only applies when RightMargin is greater than 80 and you are operating in graphics mode without a 132-column adapter.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.CompensateFrameSpaces
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how Reflection handles spaces when aligning data on screen.
member.remarks:
This property is relevant for Thai character set support only; change only if you use the Thai version of Windows.
If Reflection uses a proportional font, this property specifies the number of spaces after which text characters are realigned to display on monospaced boundaries.
For example, if the terminal window displays two columns of data with at least three spaces between columns on any particular line, setting this property to three (3) ensures that the second column of data is left-aligned.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.CompressBlankLinesEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how Reflection handles blank lines in display memory.
member.remarks:
This property only affects lines that have scrolled off the screen.
When this property is true, Reflection compresses multiple blank lines in display memory into a single blank line.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.CopyDataFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the copy format.
member.remarks: Format can be Lines, Unformatted or Paragraph.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.CopyTableMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the copy table method.
member.remarks: Method can be Detect Columns (based on vertical space alignment) or Replace Spaces (which replaces multiple spaces or tabs with a single tab).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.CopyGraphicsBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether bitmaps copied to the Clipboard are edited to set the background color to white and near-white colors to black.
member.remarks: This is useful for pasting graphic images into word-processing documents.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.CopyGraphicsVGAColors
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether bitmaps copied to the Clipboard are dithered to standard VGA colors.
member.remarks: This is useful for pasting graphic images into Windows applications that do not recognize color palettes (for example, Windows Paintbrush). (Dithering options are controlled by the ImageDither property.)

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.CursorColumn
member.summary: Gets the column that contains the cursor in the terminal window, relative to the left edge of the screen.
member.remarks: The number is one-based (that is, the first column is column 1).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.CursorRow
member.summary: Gets the row that contains the cursor in the terminal window, relative to the top of the screen (in host-addressable coordinates).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.DisplayColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the number of columns displayed in the terminal window.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.DisplayEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Reflection displays characters received from the host during the execution of any of the following methods: ReadChars, ReadLine, or ReadUntil.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.DisplayMemoryBlocks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the number of 8-kilobyte blocks allocated to display memory.
member.remarks: Display memory contains both the information visible on the display and information that has scrolled off the display. It is a log of what has recently been sent from the host to the PC. The default value is nine 8K blocks, or 72K of display memory.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.DisplayMemoryTopRow
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the top row of display memory using host-addressable coordinates.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.DisplayRows
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the number of lines in each page of display memory.
member.remarks: The host can position the cursor and write characters on any row in the specified range.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.DrawingOptimization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Reflection uses drawing optimization features to control the timing of changes to the screen display.
member.remarks: Use the default value (true) for the best performance with most host applications.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.DynamicTerminalSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Reflection supports the dynamic update of the number of rows and columns in the display when the user resizes the terminal window.
member.remarks: You can set this property to true only when emulating a VT terminal. Your Telnet server and application must also support NAWS (Negotiate About Window Size) otherwise display problems can occur. DynamicTerminalSize and AutoFontSize are mutually exclusive options; when one is set to true, the other is automatically set to false.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.EndOfLineWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Reflection automatically inserts a carriage return and linefeed at the end of a line.
member.remarks:
When this property is set to true, Reflection automatically inserts a carriage return and a linefeed.
When the value is false, the cursor is not automatically advanced. If you type additional characters, those characters overwrite previously typed characters until you move the cursor.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.ForceAutoRepeat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Reflection ignores the current value of the AutoRepeat property and always auto repeats (causing most keys to repeat when you hold the key down).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.IbmIsBlockMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Block mode state is enabled for IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.IbmCharInsertionOption
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how character insertion is handled during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).
member.remarks: When this property is true, a character insertion forces a character off a row (or off the end of the screen if Autowrap is on) unless a null character can be deleted to accommodate the insertion.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.IbmLineInsertionOption
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how line insertion is handled during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).
member.remarks: When this property is true, a line insertion forces the last line off the screen unless a null line can be deleted to accommodate the insertion.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.IbmClearModified
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the MDT (Modified Data Tag) is cleared after data is sent to the host during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.IbmIgnoreNull
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether nulls received from the host are ignored during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.IbmSendTrailingNulls
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether trailing nulls are sent to the host during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).
member.remarks: This property is only relevant in Block mode.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.ImageUseCurrentColorMap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating what happens when color bitmaps are pasted from the Clipboard.
member.remarks:
When this property is set to true, 256-color bitmaps pasted from the Clipboard are dithered to the current color map values.
When this property is set to false, the color map that best represents the colors in the pasted bitmap is calculated.
Dithering options are controlled by the ImageDither property.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.ImageColorMapFleshtonePriority
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating what happens when a 256-color image is pasted from the Clipboard to the Reflection terminal window.
member.remarks:
Reflection uses an algorithm to determine exactly how colors should be mapped when emulating 16-bit terminals.
Setting ImageFleshtones to true causes Reflection to give more priority to accurately representing colors like red, brown, yellow, and pink from the original 256-color image, rather than to colors like blue and green.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.InactivityEventsIgnoreKeyboardMouse
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how Reflection handles keyboard and mouse actions with events that are scheduled to execute after a period of inactivity.
member.remarks:
When this property is true (the default), mouse and keyboard activity are ignored, the period of inactivity is counted down, and the scheduled event is executed.
When this property is false, keystrokes and mouse clicks reset the inactivity countdown when the Reflection terminal window has focus. Moving the mouse resets the inactivity countdown when Reflection is the foreground application.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.InsertMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether characters can be added to text in the terminal window without typing over existing characters.
member.remarks:
When this property is set to true, new characters are inserted at the cursor location, and existing characters are moved to the right.
When this property is set to false, typing over existing characters replaces those characters.
This property is relevant when Reflection is in Block mode.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.ReverseVideo
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the foreground and background colors for screen attributes are reversed.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.IsJISRoman
member.summary: This property returns or specifies how character 92 is displayed when HostCharacterSet is set to rcDECKanji1983 or rcDECKanji1978.
member.remarks:
When this property is set to true, character 92 is displayed as a Yen character and the character set in G0 is JIS-Roman.
When this parameter is set to false, character 92 is displayed as a backslash character (\) and the character set in G0 is ASCII.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.UseKatakanaCharacterSet
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Katakana or Kanji character set is used by default when HostCharacterSet is set to rcDECKanji1983 or rcDECKanji1978.
member.remarks:
When this property is set to true, Reflection uses the Katakana character set.
When it is set to false, Reflection uses the Kanji character set.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.IsKeyboardLocked
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the keyboard and the toolbar are locked (that is, they cannot be used).
member.remarks: When this property is set to true, the keyboard and toolbar are locked.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.MaintainUnscaledImage
member.summary: By default, Reflection scales images down so that an entire image fits on the PC display.
member.remarks:
Set this property to true to display images in full scale.
Use the Alt key with the arrow keys to pan the window.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.MarginClickSelectsLine
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating what occurs when the mouse is clicked in the left margin of the terminal window.
member.remarks: When this property is true (the default) the mouse click selects the entire line. When it is false, the mouse click does not select any text.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.MarginBellEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a bell sounds when the cursor reaches the column that is eight spaces left of the right margin.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.MouseColumn
member.summary: Gets the column location where the mouse was last clicked in the terminal screen.
member.remarks: A click in the first column sets this property to zero (0).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.MouseRow
member.summary: Gets the row location (in host-addressable coordinates) where the mouse was last clicked in the terminal screen.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.MultiplePageTerminal
member.summary: If you run a host application that requires the terminal to have a single page of memory (24 lines), set this property to false.
member.remarks: With Reflection, your PC can emulate a multi-page terminal that dynamically stores data.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.NumLock
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the NumLock keyboard function is on or off.
member.remarks: When this property is true, the numeric keypad is in numeric mode. When it is false, the numeric keypad is in cursor-positioning mode.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.OnDemandFontsEnabled
member.summary: On-demand font-loading (ODL) is a Digital Japan feature that was added to Reflection version 5.2 (along with related features such as VT382 font-preloading and Gyoukan-Keisen line drawing).
member.remarks: Set this property to true if you use an EUC double-byte Japanese character set and want to use ODL for xA121-xFE7E.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.PageCoupling
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the cursor is coupled to the current page in page memory, or if moving the cursor to another page causes that page to be displayed.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.PasteBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the size of a "paste block" (that is, the number of characters pasted from the Clipboard to the terminal window before a pause occurs).
member.remarks: See the description for the PasteDelay property for information on configuring the length of the pause and on conditions that can terminate the pause.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.PasteDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how long (in tenths of a second) Reflection waits between "paste blocks" when pasting data from the Clipboard into display memory.
member.remarks:
See the description for the PasteBufferSize property for information on configuring the size of a paste block.
Reflection waits for the PasteDelay interval or for the number of characters already sent to be echoed back before sending another line.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.WyseDelKeyAsDestructiveBackspace
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how a DEL character is handled for Wyse terminal emulation only.
member.remarks: When this property is true, a DEL character is interpreted as a destructive backspace.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.ReGISMoveMouse
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating what happens to the ReGIS cursor when you move the Windows mouse to a location in the Reflection terminal window that is different from the position the host has established.
member.remarks: To disable this feature and enable the ability to "click ahead," change the setting of ReGISMoveMouse to false.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.ReGISRestoreTextColors
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Reflection restores text colors after ReGIS graphics have been drawn.
member.remarks:
When this property is set to true, colors are temporarily saved by Reflection when all three of the following events occur:
Reflection is placed into ReGIS mode by a graphics application.
The application changes your colors.
A ReGIS or sixel image is drawn on the screen.
Text colors are restored when either the screen is cleared (with the sequence H, J, or 2J), or the application exits ReGIS mode and the entire image scrolls off the screen (for example, as the result of a series of characters).
This behavior differs from an actual terminal, where your original colors are never restored when changed by a graphics application. If colors were changed in ReGIS but no graphics were drawn, the original colors are not restored. This preserves the intent of some text applications that use ReGIS to change screen colors.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.ScreenTopRow
member.summary: Returns the row number of the top row of the screen (in host-addressable coordinates).
member.remarks: The ScreenTopRow value is always zero unless Reflection is emulating an HP terminal.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.SavePageOnClear
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether onscreen data is saved in display memory when the host clears the display.
member.remarks: Applications on the host often send escape sequences to clear the screen in whole or in part. When the screen is cleared, the data that was displayed is lost. When this property is set to true and such an escape sequence is received, the current display is cleared from view and saved in display memory, and the cursor is positioned at the top of the screen.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.ShowControlCharacters
member.summary: When this property is set to true, Reflection displays control characters but does not execute the functions these characters would otherwise perform.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.SlashZeros
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether zeros are displayed with a slash mark () in the terminal window.
member.remarks: When this property is true, zeros are displayed with slash marks. When it is false (the default), zeros are not displayed with slash marks.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.SmoothScroll
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the scroll speed setting.
member.remarks: When this property is set to true, data from the host scrolls slowly and evenly. (Changing this value to true is equivalent to changing the Scrolling option on the Screen tab of the Display Setup dialog box to Smooth.)

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.TransmitXonXoffEnabled
member.summary: When this property is set to false, the Ctrl+S keystroke executes the hold screen keyboard function, and the Ctrl+Q keystroke cancels the hold screen; neither keystroke actually transmits anything to the host. When TransmitXonXoff is set to True, Ctrl+S and Ctrl+Q are transmitted, and the hold screen function is not invoked. This property is automatically set to True when TerminalType is set to rcANSIBBS or rcANSIUNIX; it is automatically set to False when the value of TerminalType is changed from rcANSIBBS or rcANSIUNIX to any other value.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.TVIAttributeSpaceEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a visual attribute should or should not occupy a character space in display memory when Reflection is emulating a TVI terminal (TerminalType = rcTVI955). When this property is False, visual attributes in display memory do not occupy a character space. When it is True, a visual attribute will occupy a character space in display memory.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.UseAnsiColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the host can transmit ANSI color sequences to Reflection, thereby changing the foreground and background colors for characters displayed in the terminal window. This property applies to the display of ANSI color sequences in Reflection; it does not apply to printing with Reflection.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.VerticalCoupling
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the row in which the cursor is located remains in the terminal window regardless of how the terminal window is resized or which screen font size is used.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.ClearDisplayOnWidthChangeEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the screen display is cleared when the number of screen columns is changed. The number of screen columns can be specified using either the DisplayColumns property or the Screen tab in the Display Setup dialog box.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.WordSelectionBoundaryExclusive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating a string of characters that mark the beginning or end of a "word" when using a mouse to select words in the terminal window. These "exclusive" characters are not included in the word that is selected.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.WordSelectionBoundaryInclusive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating a string of characters that mark the beginning or end of a word when using a mouse to select words in the terminal window. These "inclusive" characters are included as part of the word that is selected.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.WyseBlockMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a Wyse terminal is in Block Mode. The value of this property is not saved to a settings file.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.WyseLabelLines
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how many label lines are visible. The terminal decides how many label lines are visible by how many display rows are requested. Reflection allows you to always have two if you want. If only one label line is visible, pressing the SHIFT key will display the second line. This property is valid only during Wyse terminal emulation.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.WyseProtectMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the terminal is in Protect Mode. In Protect Mode, the cursor is not allowed to move into areas of the screen that are write-protected. Cursor movement keys and the tab and backtab keys move from one unprotected area to the next unprotected area. This property is valid only during Wyse terminal emulation. The value of this property is not saved to a settings file.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.IbmEnterKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how the Enter key behaves during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.IbmInsertion
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the behavior of the Insert Key during 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.IbmReceivedCR
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how a received carriage return is interpreted during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.IbmReceivedLF
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how a received line feed is interpreted during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.IbmReturnKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the behavior of the Return key during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.IbmSendKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how the Send key behaves during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.IbmTabKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how the Tab key behaves during IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.IbmTurnAroundChar
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating defines the LineTurnAround (LTA) character for IBM 3151 terminal sessions (TerminalType = rcIBM3151).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.ImageDither
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating what happens when a 256-color image is pasted into the Reflection terminal window from the Clipboard. Because Reflection for ReGIS Graphics emulates a 16-color terminal, Reflection uses an algorithm to determine exactly how colors should be mapped. Try all three values to see which works best for a particular image.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.JumpScrollSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how Reflection manages data entering display memory. Setting JumpScrollSpeed to rcScrollBy1 refreshes the screen every time a line enters display memory. Higher numerical values (rcScrollBy2, rcScrollBy4, and so on, up to rcScrollBy128) refresh the screen after the specified number of lines have entered display memoryassuming data is entering display memory too fast for the display to keep up.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.WyseReceivedCR
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how a received carriage return (CR) is interpreted. This property is valid only during Wyse terminal emulation.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.ScrollOptimization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating when Reflection uses an off-screen bitmap to speed up scrolling. With most EGA and VGA video adapters, it's usually more efficient to use this off-screen bitmap, but with video adapters that support higher resolutions and more colors, it may be more efficient not to use the bitmap. When this property is set to rcAuto, Reflection automatically adjusts to either use or not use the off-screen bitmap, depending on the capabilities of the video adapter.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.TektronixDefaultFontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the default font size for Tektronix emulation.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.TVIAttributeBaseMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how visual attributes are applied when Reflection is emulating a TVI terminal (TerminalType = rcTVI955).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.TVIBottomStatusLine
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating usage and display of the bottom status line when Reflection is emulating a TVI terminal (TerminalType = rcTVI955).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.TVICompatibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating which TVI emulation type Reflection uses when TerminalType is set to rcTVI955.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.TVIDownKeySends
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the action of the Down key when Reflection is emulating a TVI terminal (TerminalType = rcTVI955).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.TVIFunctionKeySet
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how the top and bottom status line appear in Reflection's terminal window when Reflection is emulating a TVI terminal (TerminalType = rcTVI955).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.TVIStatusLineAttribute
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how the top and bottom status line appear in Reflection's terminal window when Reflection is emulating a TVI terminal (TerminalType = rcTVI955).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.TVITopStatusLine
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating usage and display of the top status line when Reflection is emulating a TVI terminal (TerminalType = rcTVI955).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.VTBackspaceSends
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating what is transmitted to the host when the user press the Backspace key. On the VT terminal keyboard the backarrow key is configurable: it can send either a delete (ASCII 127) or a backspace (ASCII 8) character. In Reflection, use this property to configure Backspace in the same manner. This property affects Reflection for HP only in VT emulation mode.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.VTCursorKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the cursor keys are under host control. This property is usually controlled by the host. If you find that your arrow keys aren't working properly, it may mean that this option was incorrectly left set to rcApplicationMode when a host program terminated abnormally. This property affects Reflection for HP only in VT emulation mode.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.WyseAttribute
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the Wyse terminal display attribute mode (for Wyse terminal emulation only).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.WyseBlockTerminator
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the end-of-transmission delimiter for block sends.
member.remarks: This is typically set by the host application. This property is valid only for Wyse terminal emulations.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.WyseEnterKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating what is sent to the host when the ENTER key is pressed.
member.remarks: This property is valid only for Wyse terminal emulations.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.WyseReturnKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating what is sent to the host when the RETURN key is pressed.
member.remarks: This property is valid only for Wyse terminal emulations.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Screen.WyseStatusLineDisplay
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Wyse status line at the top of the screen is set to Off, Standard, or Edit.

member.summary: This event is triggered before Reflection transmits a terminal keystroke to the host.

member.summary: This event is triggered immediately after Reflection transmits a terminal keystroke to the host.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal
member.summary: The Terminal is an Open Systems host emulation session object.
member.remarks: The control Guid is {BE835A80-CAB2-40d2-AFC0-6848E486BF58}. These Guids are used as the input parameters for CreateControl( Guid controlType) in the Application object.

member.summary: The constructor, for internal use.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.Execute(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.InputMapAction)
member.summary: Execute a given action. Actions possible is defined in InputMapActionID.
member.param: The action to be executed.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates the success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.CloseAllConnections
member.summary: Closes all connections established by the current copy of Reflection.
member.remarks: This method disconnects the current connection (if any) and any suspended connections previously established. This method does not affect connections opened by other copies of Reflection.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.Connect
member.summary: Connects to the host. It is ignored if a connection already exists.
member.remarks: Use the IsConnected property to determine if a connection already exists. Use HostCommTimeout to specify how many seconds Reflection should wait for a host response.
member.returns: Connection status

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.Dial(System.String)
member.summary: Dials a modem. This method is only valid if Reflection is set to use the old modem dialer (UseModemDialerV5 = true).
member.remarks: Dials a modem with default initialization string one time.
member.param: The phone number to dial. The string can contain any valid modem dialing characters, such as commas (to allow dialing to pause for two seconds per comma) and hyphens and parentheses (used as separators for better readability). The string should not include any AT commands or dialing prefix commands.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.Dial(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.SpeakerOption,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.SpeakerVolumeOption,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dials a modem. This method is only valid if Reflection is set to use the old modem dialer (UseModemDialerV5 = true).
member.param: The phone number to dial. The string can contain any valid modem dialing characters, such as commas (to allow dialing to pause for two seconds per comma) and hyphens and parentheses (used as separators for better readability). The string should not include any AT commands or dialing prefix commands; these settings should be made in the Dialing Options dialog box from the Connection Setup dialog box.
Description to be displayed in the Dialing In Progress dialog box. If this option is omitted, only the phone number appears in the dialog box.
String to be sent to the modem before dialing. If omitted, Reflection uses the default initialization string.

Specifies the amount of time to wait for the host to confirm the connection. The string is specified in HH:MM:SS.hh format. A time string of "0" causes Reflection to wait indefinitely. If this is empty (""), the default timeout (60 seconds) is used.
Specifies the number of times to redial if the number is busy or does not answer. Default value should be one retry.
Specifies the amount of time to wait before redialing. The string is specified in HH:MM:SS.hh format. If this argument is empty (""), the default timeout is used (120 seconds).
Specifies the speaker mode. The default is Dialing.
Specifies the speaker volume. The default is Medium.
If true, the modem speaker is turned off after the first dialing attempt. If false (default) or omitted, the modem speaker remains set to the SpeakerMode for each dialing attempt.
If true, Reflection ignores modem initialization string errors. If false, these errors are displayed in a message box.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects from the host. If no connection currently exists, this method is ignored.
member.remarks: Use the IsConnected property to determine if a connection already exists.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.StopTerminalInstance
member.summary: For internal use. Used when a Terminal User Control is being shut down.
member.returns: ReturnCode indicating success or failure.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.Close(Attachmate.Reflection.CloseOption)
member.summary: Close the terminal session with the close option.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.GetSerialConnectionStatistics(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ConnectionStatisticOption)
member.summary: Returns a statistic for a serial connection.
member.remarks: If the connection is not a serial connection, or if there is not connection, GetSerialStatistics returns -1. Statistics are maintained from the time a connection is established, from when the terminal session is reset (with the ResetTerminal method), or from when the Reset button is clicked in the Serial Connection Statistics dialog box.
member.param: Specifies which statistics to return.
member.returns: The requested statistic if the ConnectionType is a serial connection, or -1 if it is not.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.HangUp
member.summary: Hangs up the modem by sending the Hayes "+++" command to get the modem's attention, followed by the "ATH" hangup command.
member.remarks:
This method does not guarantee that the modem has actually hung up. No error is returned if the method fails for any reason. After the modem is hung up, the port remains open; use the Disconnect method to close the port.
Valid only if Reflection is set to use the old modem dialer (UseModemDialerV5 = true).

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.OpenSettings(System.String)
member.summary: Opens a setting file.
member.param: Specifies the path and filename for the settings file.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.ResetTerminal(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ResetOptions)
member.summary: Executes a terminal reset.
member.param: Terminal reset option.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.RestoreDefault(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.RestoreOptions)
member.summary: Restores the session settings to the default settings, as specified by the restore option value.
member.param: Restore setting options.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.ResumeConnection(System.Int32)
member.summary: Resumes a previously suspended connection (suspend connections with the SuspendConnection method).
member.remarks: Only sessions that were established and suspended in the same copy of Reflection can be resumed. Resuming a connection updates the value of the ConnectionType and ConnectionSettings properties in accordance with the newly resumed connection.
member.param: Identifies the connection to resume. Obtain this from the SuspendCurrentConnection method.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.Save
member.summary: This method saves all settings.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.SaveAs(System.String)
member.summary: Saves all settings to the specified file.
member.param: The fully qualified file path of the file you want to save. The file must be saved in a trusted location.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicate success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.StartTrace(System.String,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.TraceFileExistsOption,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.TraceFormatOption)
member.summary: Starts capturing data coming from the host to a disk file.
member.remarks: Data being transmitted to the host can also be captured. The captured data includes all escape sequences and control codes, but does not include flow control, such as Xon/Xoff characters. The data is captured in binary format and is not translated in any way.
member.param: Specifies the file to which data is written.
Specifies what to do if the file already exists. The default is OpenError.
Specifies what kind of trace to perform. The default is TraceDefault.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.StopTrace
member.summary: Stops capturing incoming host data to a file and closes the trace file.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.ProcessTrace(System.String,System.String,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ProcessTraceOptions,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.ProcessTraceSyntax)
member.summary: Process a trace file created by StartTrace()/StopTrace().
member.param: Fully qualified input trace file name (i.e. drive:\path\filename).
Fully qualified output file name (i.e. drive:\path\filename).
Trace file processing options.
Trace file output syntax options.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.SuspendCurrentConnection
member.summary: Suspends the current host connection (so that it can be resumed later with ResumeConnection).
member.returns: A numeric identifier for the suspended connection that can be used to later resume the connection.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.WaitForCall
member.summary: Initializes the modem to automatically answer an incoming call and opens a status dialog box until a connection has been established.
member.remarks: This method does not check to see whether a modem is actually connected to the serial port; it simply transmits the Hayes "AT" command to get the modem's attention, then transmits the "ATS0=1" command to place the modem in answer mode. If the command fails for any reason, no error is returned. The procedure continues to the next statement only after the status box is dismissed (either because the modem established a connection, the user canceled, or the dialog box timed out).
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.WaitForCall(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the modem to automatically answer an incoming call and opens a status dialog box until a connection has been established.
member.remarks: This method does not check to see whether a modem is actually connected to the serial port. It simply transmits the Hayes "AT" command to get the modem's attention, then transmits the "ATS0=1" command to place the modem in answer mode. If the command fails for any reason, no error is returned. The procedure continues to the next statement only after the status box is dismissed (either because the modem established a connection, the user canceled, or the dialog box timed out).
member.param: Specifies a message to be displayed in the Waiting for Call dialog box.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.WaitForCall(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the modem to automatically answer an incoming call and opens a status dialog box until a connection has been established.
member.remarks: This method does not check to see whether a modem is actually connected to the serial port. It simply transmits the Hayes "AT" command to get the modem's attention, then transmits the "ATS0=1" command to place the modem in answer mode. If the command fails for any reason, no error is returned. The procedure continues to the next statement only after the status box is dismissed (either because the modem established a connection, the user canceled, or the dialog box timed out).
member.param: Specifies a message to be displayed in the Waiting for Call dialog box.
Specifies an initialization string to be sent to the modem before waiting.
member.returns: ReturnCode value indicates success or error conditions.

member.summary: Issues a request to the Reflection Security Gateway for a DASO pass ticket. On success, the DASOUserID and DASOPassTicket properties will be valid and can be used for automated sign on to the host. member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.TerminalUserControlContext
member.summary: This is an internal property used to determine the context of this terminal object usage. This is set to true if this terminal object is being used in a Terminal User Control context.
member.remarks: The default is false.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.AllowJIS
member.summary: Gets or sets whether JIS escape sequences are allowed when other host character sets are selected.
member.remarks: When this property is false, JIS characters will be displayed only when a JIS mode (JIS 1978, JIS 1983, JIS 1990, or JIS Katakana) is selected. When it is true, JIS escape sequences are allowed when other Japanese character sets (such as EUC or SJIS) are selected.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.AnswerBack
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that is sent to the host when Reflection receives an Enq character from the host.
member.remarks:
When EnqAck is set to true, Reflection sends an Ack character in response to an Enq from the host, and the value of AnswerBack is ignored.
This property is relevant only when the EnqAck property is set to false.
member.value: The default value is "". The string cannot be more than 30 characters long.
member.exception: Thrown if the set parameter is too long for the current terminal type.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.AutoAnswerback
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the answerback message (set with the AnswerBack property) is automatically sent to the host after a communications line connection.
member.value: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.AutoConnect
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifes whether to attempt to establish a host connection as soon as the current settings file is loaded.
member.remarks: You must save the current settings file after changing the value of this property. This property causes an error when Reflection is connected to a host. Use the IsConnected property to determine if a connection already exists.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.BellEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a bell sounds when the ASCII bell character (decimal 7) is transmitted from the keyboard or received from the host.
member.value: The default value is true.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.BlockTerminator
member.summary: Gets or sets a block terminator character to be transmitted at the end of each block data transmission.
member.value: The default value for UNIX and OpenVMS and ReGIS Graphics is Chr$(rcSUB). Only ANSI characters with values from 0 to 31 are valid for this property. Use a characters to designate one of these characters.
member.exception: Thrown if the set parameter is outside the range of valid values.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.CitrixIPAddress

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.CitrixPCName
member.summary: Gets the PC name returned by a Citrix host.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.CitrixUserName
member.summary: Gets the Username value for a Citrix connection type.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.OpenSystems.Terminal.ClearDisplayOnDisconnect

member.remarks: When this property is true, Reflection clears the screen on disconnect from the host. When it is false, data the display memory is retained.
